Reviews.Title: “Adorable”
Reviews.Author: jar60
Reviews.Content: This is the most charming hotel I have ever stayed in. I really havent anything bad to say about it as everything was perfect. Our room which was in the annex was beautifull,richly decorated and spotlessly clean. However on the second day we were there, we were informed there was a problem with the water in our room. Staff were most appologetic and moved our luggage for us. We were given a lovely room that overlooked the Bridge of Sighs. A beautifull, romantic hotel, wouldnt stay anywhere else in Venice. Thaks to all the staff who made our holiday so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware that this hotel uses an Annex!”
Reviews.Author: Me-from-the-UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated in central Venice, right by a canal and within sight of the Bridge of Sighs. It is within very easy walking distance of San Marco. Be aware that this hotel has an annex across a small internal courtyard - our room was in that. The room had 2 windows, one opening onto a central air shaft and the other opening onto a view of an air conditioning unit about 2 metres away. The annex rooms have their own breakfast room, with a handful of 2-seater tables arranged side-by-side in a line in a (richly decorated) hallway where the buffet breakfast is set out. This was the worst part of the experience, because the breakfast is prepared right outside your bedroom door and it is inevitably going to be noisy. The room itself was richly furnished, although small. There was only single chair for a double room. You had to be quite a contortionist to use the bathroom, which did not have a fixed shower, only something relating to the taps of the bath and which you had to hold up yourself. Above our room in the Annex was at least another couple of floors which seemed to be nothing to do with the hotel. We could hear the occupants of the room above us get out of bed sharp at 6:30 every morning and clatter around for an hour or so before, presumeably, setting off to work. The staff were unfailingly friendly, and prepared to speak English. They provided helpful suggestions, and seemed genuinely friendly. The main part of the hotel has a sort of sitting room, plus a very small bar, again very richly furnished. We visited in the week following Easter Sunday, and were delighted to find that a large Easter Egg was divided up by the hotel for all the patrons - this was a very nice touch. I suppose that the Annex rooms are cheaper, but if you want to have a canal view or to be in the main hotel take care to specify this when booking!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Pimento
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel made us feel very welcome! The front desk staff and the bellman were all friendly and professional. We enjoyed drinking our Bellini in the sitting room which was very cozy. Overall this hotel has a small feel to it, which matched our room- small. We were a family of three and while our room was attractive, there was little space to put our suitcases out so that we were not tripping on them. Unfortunately I do not remember our 2nd floor room number but if you need a larger room, make sure to specify at the time that you book because all rooms are not created equally. Also, while this hotel does have their own dock for the water taxis, if the tide is too high the boat may not be able to make use of it. Having said this, they are a very short walk from San Marco Plaza where you can catch a public water taxi. Good experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maumau3
Reviews.Content: How can you fault such a cozy quaint hotel right on the lagoon! You cannot! We loved the hotel. Room was decorated to perfection. Windows overlooking the lagoon made you feel like you were really on the water . You could open them up and sit on the edge (not sure I was suppost to but did) and watch the boats go by. So close to the main square and action but yet very quiet. Breakfast was done very nicely. No waiting and all the basics and freindly service. We had our teenage son so a cot brought in and still roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ! Central yet tranquil setting .”
Reviews.Author: Thorne4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and it was a very difficult decision choosing a hotel with so many choices. The Colombina was perfect - central yet tranquil - we were fortunate to have a room with a balcony (#207) overlooking the canal and clear view of Bridge of Sighs . Our room was very clean, comfortable and Venetian style . The hotel staff were all very friendly, helpful and the service was excellent. Breakfast was always well prepared and good choice . I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in March of 2012. Our first impression was as we pulled up to the hotel's private dock via a water taxi (hired at airport). Such a wonderful and unique expirence it was. The hotel greeted us as we unboarded the boat while they handled our bags. The check in was hassle free and then we were guided to our room. The room was small, which to my understanding is common is Europe, but it was cozy, clean and had a good sized bathroom. The maid service was good as well giving us turndown service each day while leaving us chocolate on our pilliows along with the next days weather report. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. In particular, Marco at the front desk was a pleasure. He helped us find good restuarants, hired a private canal boat tour for us and serveral other hotel guests and was always in the mood to just chat about everything and anything. He made us feel very welcomed during our entire stay. The location is perhaps the best feature of the hotel. It is minutes from Saint Marks Sq, about 10 minutes from the Rialto Bridge, and minutes from the public boat dock (their version of a city bus) that can take you anywhere you weren't willing to walk to. The only complaint I would have was that the room was on the hot side. Our solution, of course, was to open the window as we slept. This was a perfect invite for mosquitos to attack us all night. By the 3rd night, we had to sleep with no window open in order to avoid the mosquitos. A perfect remedy for this would simply to put screens over the windows...then it'd be problem solved. All in all, I would stay here again. I would come better prepared next time with a face fan that works on 220v :( Venice is a wonderful place and the Hotel Colombina really helps you expirence the city the way it meant to be. Your Friends, Andrew & Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: SPI424
Reviews.Content: I am a little late writing this review, but I had to come back and give the hotel its due diligence. This hotel is magical. The trek to the hotel was very quaint, through narrowed, brick-layed Venice alleys, across adorable, little bridges and around the corner to see the Hotel Colombina sign. One can also arrive via water taxi or Gondola. Just magical. Once in our room, we noted a traditional Venetian decor and ambiance. We had two beautifully enormous, shuttered windows that opened to the canal below so that we could see gondoliers rowing by. Did I mention it was magical? The staff was top-notch, arranging our gondola ride and offering direction when needed. St. Mark's Square and the Doge's palace is a very short walk away. I am dreaming of it as we speak. Just magical.

Reviews.Title: “The best 4 star Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Maureen T
Reviews.Content: I have visited Venice on a regular basis both with my husband and alone for the past 4 years and I return to the Colombina each time. I will do so again in the Autumn for my second visit this year. The hotel is in a perfect location, offers customer service second to none, the rooms are exceptionally comfortable and well presented and breakfast is always a happy experience. Congratulations and thanks to all who are involved in my stays at the Colombina and I can highly recomend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Can't wait to return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gazza45
Reviews.Content: It was my wife's 50th birthday and we had decided to celebrate it in Venice along with two very good friends. From arriving at this hotel to leaving, all the staff were very polite and attentive. The hotel's location is very local to St Marks Square, just a five minute walk. The room we had was very nice complete with ensuite, minibar (which we didn't use). The room had a lovey beamed ceiling and a view over a courtyard. The breakfast was very nice, comprising of croissants, fruit juice, rice crispies, muesli, prunes, ham, cheese. On our final morning there was a gorgeously moist almond cake. Oh I forgot, the coffee is lovely and strong - just how we like it!! As an example of how good the staff are, when we returned to Manchester airport my wife found that she didn't have her mobile phone with her. The only place we could think it could be was back at the hotel in Venice on the breakfast table. A quick phone call to the hotel confirmed this and the staff set the wheels in motion to courier it back to us. The accepted an email with credit card details to cover the shipping costs. The phone has now returned from it's extended holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “The warmth of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: What can we say....we loved the hotel from the moment we arrived via water taxi. We were greeted by Paolo Ciriotto at the front desk whom we fell in love with from the start. His warmth and enthusiasm about the city itself made the trip that much more meaningful. Even the night deskman was so very helpful with providing us with train schedules and local information. From check in to check out, the room, and location were excellent. It's off the beaten path but close enough to everything. The view from our window overlooking the Bridge of Sighs and charming canal entryway made it even more magical. For the price, this was a truly authentic Venetian hotel, unlike those expensive commercial places on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Children friendly”
Reviews.Author: Yaptrap
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice with four children age 8 to 14. The staff at check in spoke at least three language (french, english, italian). He took the time to give a business card of the hotel to each children with instruction of going in a shop if they get lost and to show the card so that the owner can reach the hotel and they send somebody to get the child. If you ever been to Venice, you know that loosing a child is a possibility and offering the solution even before we, the parents thought about a plan is very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel on Small Canal”
Reviews.Author: LuckySCGirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very nice and clean room facing canal. Small yet very comfortable. Staff was very nice and friendly. Enjoyed the breakfast and sitting in the common living room enjoying a cocktail. Very close to St. Peters square and lots of shopping and great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and really friendly staff. A real find!”
Reviews.Author: Quinney22
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located traditional boutique hotel with a real friendly atmosphere. We've stayed a few times now and have resisted exploring other hotels because this covers the bases really well. We've stayed in a range of rooms and Alessandro helped us choose room 104 which has a small balcony for you to overlook the bridge of sighs and the Gondoliers and tourists who routinely wave and take photos of you because you're so close. I know some rooms are smaller than others. Other rooms may have more space or higher ceilings, but this is a great room! Real character! Can't thank the team enough. This was our 10th wedding Anniversary and we stayed here for our honeymoon 10 years ago! We wouldn't be back if wasn't warm and welcoming! But the location is ideal for Saint Mark's square and the surrounding streets with shops, restaurants and pretty views all in easy reach! Thanks Alessandro!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a Great Find,Some friends recommend it and i have to it was Excellent. 3 min walk from all the sites yet you would never know,It was so peacefull very well looked after rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: waxie01
Reviews.Content: This is an EXCELLENT hotel and great value for money. Only 6-7 minuites walk from San Zaccaria Bus Stop, and just 100 metres from San Marco, it is ideally situated for a great time in Venice. The staff are friendly, caring and professional in every way from the front of house team, through to the lounge staff, room maids and breakfast team. It is beautifully decorated, very relaxing and comfortable. This was our 6th anual visit to Venice, and our 6th time staying at the Hotel Colombina. Such is the hotel, we would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: theo466
Reviews.Content: we just had 5 nights in this perfect hotel just so close to all that venice offers . the room was beutifully furnished with classic fabrics and even a chandalier . the staff were friendly and efficient. just faultless

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Ocdgirl01
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels all over Europe and usually go for the high end expensive rooms. This room was much cheaper than what we would usually pay for a short stay but was one the nicest we have ever had. A beautiful view, friendly staff, very clean and two VERY happy guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bolshiegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Colombina for 3 nights on a couples mini-break. The location for a Venice first-timer cannot be matched - Piazza San Marco is minutes away, the Bridge of Sighs arches over the adjacent canal and a multitude of bars, shops and restaurants are on the doorstep. The decor is a bit tired for a 4-star hotel, but the rooms are clean and a good size and staff are friendly and helpful. An upgrade to a Canal View room is well worth it - we could see the city waking up, boats and gondolas traveling up and down, locals going about their daily business. We could see right down the canal to the Bridge of Sighs and even had a glimpse of the top of the tower in San Marco. Overall, a really pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & location - service let it down”
Reviews.Author: StuartS2011
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us travelling through Europe felt although the hotel was fantastic, the rooms incredile and the location second to none the service from the front desk staff left a bit to desired. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. We could speak fluent English German and Dutch so language was not an issue but the attitude was always very off and nonchalant. No free wi-fi and had to pay and sit in the lounge to use rather than in room. Expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time with the Hotel being so close to St Marks. Room was not very big but adequate and the bathroom was a good size. Our bathroom drain had a smell which we complained about and it was sorted while we were out so we have no complaints about the service. Our room was in the Annexe building next door and we would have preferred to be in the main building but we were happy enough. The window looked out to an internal square so it was very quiet. Breakfast was average though there was plenty of food. Location is the best with the Hotel just being far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to many, many restaurants. We would stay here again. We did not eat at the restaurant as we were out all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSharon
Reviews.Content: The Colombina Hotel is in a great location, very close to St. Markâ€™s Square and has a view on the Bridge of Sighs. Our room was beautiful. It was very large, with tall ceilings, a beautiful chandlier, silk-covered walls, and luxurious bathroom. The bed was very comfortable.The staff was very professional. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location... Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beck F
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend stay in Venice with my boyfriends and we stayed here - it was lovely. ALL of the staff were helpful, courteous and overall incredibly welcoming. The hotel is perfect distance from everything. You can see the Bridge of Sighs (behind view) from both the canal stop out front and the bridge as you cross the canal walking into the side entrance - so about 5 mins walk from San Marco. Everything in Venice can be quite easily accessed with the right sense of direction - which can be difficult to maintain! - but the staff were so helpful in providing directions, maps etc. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very warm. The breakfast buffet is a definite plus - delicious! Overall we had an amazing time, owing in no small part to the staff of Hotel Columbina. Definitely recommended and will DEFINITELY be coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality in rainy Venice”
Reviews.Author: elizabethLongBeachCA
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice to 40 degree weather and a forecast of rain. Luckily we had booked a past favorite hotel, the Colombina. One of the best qualities of the hotel is its location just behind St Mark's Basilica on the same quiet canal as the Bridge of Sighs. After walking all day, it's an easy stroll back to the hotel. Also close are all the vaporetti stops just about 3 blocks away. Another wonderful trait of the hotel is the staff. The clerks behind the desk are supremely professional, know every detail of the city, and are sincerely motivated to help. We had booked a room in the main hotel, but due to the illness of another client, we were shown to a room in the annex. It was huge, with 20 foot ceilings, silk-covered walls, and luxurious fittings. Although we weren't on the canal as we had hoped, we loved the room.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful venice”
Reviews.Author: hunnnny
Reviews.Content: Hotel more than adequate a la European standard: remember there are no real streets on the island, and most of the hotels are located in tiny alleyways called callies that are very easy to miss...If you want to get the most bang for your buck, take water buses instead of water taxis ( which are rip-offs ). The cost for public transit is about 10% of water taxi,and you can go to all the attractions (and hotels) you would want to visit.The best maps you can get are from the tourist office. As one of the tour guide put it :forget about maps , just follow the yellow arrow signs and they will lead you to main points of interests on the island, or simply roam at will and you will find very good shopping bargains as well as restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colombina is in a perfect location, a 2-minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The hotel is charming, and our room was immaculate. The staff could not have been more pleasant and accommodating. They even had someone waiting when our water taxi arrived from the airport, and he wheeled our bags to the hotel and carried them in for us. Breakfast was good. I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbina”
Reviews.Author: tunnu
Reviews.Content: Actually ,I had unkowingly booked at the Locanda Remedio,which is attached to this hotel. Not too bad a place to stay-clean rooms,more like an attic. The shower needs a special mention- If your waist size is bigger than 42 inches,be warned:you may not be able to enter.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near St Marks square”
Reviews.Author: Aviator311
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked three nights at the hotel. Upon checking in we were informed that the room we booked in the main hotel was not available due to a sick guest who had to stay an additional night. We were given a shoebox sized room in the annex section for the first night, but received an upgraded room in the main hotel, with a canal view, the next two nights. The difference was like night and day. A canal view room in the main hotel is a must! I would rate the larger room a 5 and the smaller annex room a 1. This is why my overall room rating is 3. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for our stay in beautiful/magical Venice and we enjoyed our stay once the room problem was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on Canal”
Reviews.Author: frau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for five nights starting October 13,we had a view of the canal from our room which was very nice. The breakfast was good and they kept the coffee coming,they also take you to a glass blowing demo at Murano.The desk will also provide restaurants for dinner that are not on tourist row.Great location and value,five minute walk to Piazza San Marco mike de la pena

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the hotel, not annex”
Reviews.Author: Larkita
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Venice with 4 friends so we booked two rooms at the Hotel Colombina, one double room and one triple. Although we knew one would be in the annex, we did not realize how different the two rooms would be. The triple in the main hotel was very large, beautiful bathroom, window to open, while the annex was much smaller, darker, and a very small bathroom. The one thing we did not know was that the two groups would not be permitted to eat the complimentary breakfast together, the annex group had to eat in the annex, while the hotel group ate in the hotel breakfast room, dissappointing when trying to plan out the day. Also the hotel room received slippers, turn down service, and a few other little extras, which the annex does not, certainly disappointing for the annex group who paid the exact same amount for the trip. So, if at all possible make sure to book the hotel room, not the annex which really felt dungeony. Besides that, the hotel was in a perfect location, and all staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place as a base in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rex027
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Colombina is only a couple of minutes walk from San Marco Square, but as is so often the case in Venice, because of a couple of turns and a bridge, quite off the beaten track. This makes it an excellent base, near everything, but relatively quiet. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating and assisted in every way, including with advice about local restaurants, getting tickets to the opera, helping find out of the way places, etc. We were upgraded to a suite, which was remarkably large and modern, built in an apparently newly refurbished wing of the old building. This is a spot which gives access to things, but also keeps you quietly protected from the thousands of tourists in the high season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway yet Insanely Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Phineasmic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our third in Italy and we arrived by train from Florence. That is the only downside. You have to take a water bus (vaparetto) to St. Mark's square and walk your luggage five minutes to the hotel through crazy crowds - but in Venice, you really need to do that everywhere, so its no big deal. The hotel was great--right off a little rio with a view of the grand canal--with a great room and ample space to be comfortable. The staff of the hotel was great, recommending activities each day to keep us busy that were excellent. A private water taxi around the grand canal at dusk, a boat trip to Murano, and lastly, great dinner recommendations. Each place they recommended was excellent. In terms of location, you are about a two minute walk to St. Mark's square, but down side alleys so that you are away from the tourists when you head back to your hotel, which seems like a must. Great hotel--if I went back I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: rtpcorral
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colombina is a little gem! In May I traveled to Venice with my mother and daughters, aged 22 and 20. The JDB chain of hotels was recommended to me by my travel agent. So we chose Hotel Colombina based purely on its fabulous location, just 1 block from St. Marks Square. It is small, just 30ish rooms but that is what makes it special, that personal touch...Prior to arriving, I communicated to the hotel, via email, about setting up transfers from the airport, tours, etc. All was done timely and perfectly by their wonderful staff. We wrote back and forth so many times, that it was almost like family when we arrived. Instead of 2 rooms, we chose a suite for just a bit more $, and it was great. Spacious and beautifully appointed. The breakfast buffet was very good and in a beautiful space. The staff was fantastic. When the desk clerk asked us what we were doing that day, he said "no no". With the time you have, do "this" instead. So we ended up spending a wonderful day in Burano instead, which ended up being one of the highlights of our trip! A very caring staff. I cannot recommend the Hotel Colombina more highly and would never consider staying anywhere else when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelInsuranceLady
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there several times, and have used it twice for my tour groups. The staff couldn't be nicer or more accommodating. While not huge, the rooms are very confortable, bathrooms are beautiful and well appointed, and the buffet breakfast is varied and satisfying. I stay here whenever I'm in Venice (every other year) and they treat me like family. The Colombina has an annex (The Locanda del Rifugio) ....a small hotel attached to the main one. It's very comfortable, aand has lower room rates because the rooms are smaller, there's no bar (if you want a ddrink, you go next door), and the buffet breakfast is much simpler. An excellent value overall.

Reviews.Title: “valerielindsay”
Reviews.Author: valerielindsay
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful holiday in this hotel. Venice was amazing and the hotel made it all the better with its central location and beautifully decorated room. The staff were charming and very helpful and always smiling. Our room was just outside the lift on the 4th floor, we didn't have a great view but there was so much going on outside we were really only there to change for dinner. The room was kept immaculate, bed turned down at night and a card giving you the weather prospect for the next day which was a really handy touch. If ever go back to Venice would have no hesitation about booking with the same Hotel. Absolutely lovely hotel with lovely staff and breakfast was plentiful and varied although continental which is what was expected although you could pay extra if you wanted cooked eggs etc. Thanks to all who made our holiday so special. Nice touch on my birthday complimentory biscuits from the management.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: minnee77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colombina was centrally located in terms of the areas that we wanted to hit in Venice. It was a 3 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. The staff was friendly and we have A/C! Our room was small but clean and well decorated. We only say that it was small b/c with two travel suitcases it was hard to navigate but we still think the rooms were lovely. We were located in the secondary building and did have to carry our suitcases up 2 small flights of stairs but it wasn't so bad compared to a lot of older buildings in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “One to do before you die”
Reviews.Author: Big_BlueUk
Reviews.Content: What can I say; the hotel, staff and location are all excellent. It's very hard to describe how good this hotel is, although it is only about 5 minutes walk from St Mark's it feels like a million miles, a quiet and peaceful oasis in a crazy bustling city. you can literally get to the whole of Venice withing 30 minutes from here, and the restaurants recommended were all excellent. I will be returning and the one thing you must do is return to the airport via water taxi; its not cheap, but it's so "George Clooney" with a hint of making your partner feel like "Sophia Lauren"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Super Clean, Super Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: JustAddWater
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and it proved to be a wise decision after all. The hotel is just a short walk away from the San Marco square and has a small jetty for gondola and water taxi access. The rooms in the main building which we have stayed are clean and big considering that you are in fact in a historical building. The cleanliness was very very impressive even the hard to reach places were squeaky clean. The hotel has a selection of european breakfast which is quite good actually. It takes 10-15 minutes to rach the Rialto bridge and 5-10 minutes to San Marco depending on your pace. The single disappointment about the hote is the front office workesr tendency to state incorrect prices for some eternal services like the water taxi. (The stated that the water taxi costs 100 euro in fact the service costs 120 euro if you board from the hotel jetty) Also services like gondola cost much cheaper if you make your bargaining outside with the gondoliers which is also part of the fun. The room was quiet and airconditioning works great, if you need to use the internet the first 15 minutes is free of charge. The hotel has a public access pc which is by far the slowest peace of hardware this side of the planet so if you lack the patience of Buddha stay away. Will definitely stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “always great”
Reviews.Author: GFJF
Reviews.Content: I stay here 1-3 nights of my trip to Italy depending on my schedule and it is always absolutely the best experience no matter what month it is. The staff is great, the hotel is lovely, always very clean and the location centraly located to St Marks square. I highly recommend this hotel. Ciao! Fiore

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two bedroom Fenice Suite in July. Perfect for our family of four. Hotel was beautifully decorated and the staff was extremely helpful with recommendations of restaurants. The location is perfect, with just a few minute walk to both St Marks and the Rialto Bridge. We took a private water taxi from the airport and were dropped off at the hotel's dock - very convenient after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel near Piazza San marco”
Reviews.Author: broomsmelbourne
Reviews.Content: When checking in passport copied and room key supplied, no information where to have breakfast or tourist map supplied. On the following day we were asked to fill out a registration form. Allocated a room on first floor which was spacious but at times noisy from people walking around above. Good access to Tourist sites in Venice and 10 minutes walk from Vaporetto stop. Breakfast was sufficient with a European breakfast available and the staff in the restaurant were friendly. A reasonable stay after a poor impression from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: KatepDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this small lovely hotel, which is just a few minutes from saint marks square in a very quiet and picturesque part of Venice. Water Taxi Dock at the back of the hotel and we were also able to take a shared a gondola trip with 2 other couples from there, this was organised by the hotel. Hotel staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. Our hotel was a standard room with a view of the canal, the room was very very clean and pretty, I loved it. We had breakfast of light continental and it was nice. I would definitely come back to this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: StevenandCecile
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent. They have a dock that you can arrive/depart from by water (Perfect if you don't want to haul luggages everywhere). The staff were very nice and helpful. No wifi in the rooms, you have to go to the lounge area and you only have 30 free minutes. Not that expensive if you want more time though. The room was sorta clean and incredibly tiny! We had to move our luggages around all the time. Bathroom was a decent size and very functionnal. When you start walking around in Venice, you realise that the room size is not that important since you're never in it ! The city is magical. Overall, this hotel is good value for your money. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: lrsilverman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week .Its a small-ish hotel 2 minute walk from St Marks Square with its own water landing.. The hotel was excellent . The staff were extremely friendly , helpful and efficient.Nothing was too much trouble for them to organise. Even before we went there we e mailed them for advice ,and received prompt and helpful responses from Alessandro. It was very clean ,the rooms were visited by housekeeping twice a day , and the beds turned down in the afternoon, with sweets left on the bed, and a weather forecast!! I would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: joyce082
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the hotel was very quaint. We had 2 rooms which the hotel booked the rooms across the hall from each other. The breakfast was good and included. It was a wonderful place and we would definitely stay there again and recommended for families and all travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our first stay in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: KYellman
Reviews.Content: I picked all of our hotels for our Europe trip onine using TripAdvisor reviews....and although I stuck w/ 3 star hotels only because I had to get two rooms everywhere we went -- my choices when arrived at each destination far exceeded my expectations. (I wonder what 2 star looks look like?!) Hotel Colombina is right on the water making it very pretty indeed. The hotel rambles and is quirky on the inside which is what I imagine most of of the buildings do. Our two rooms in the Annex were well appointed. The staff was helpful. Wi-fi in bar lounge w/ $10 tab -- or you can buy for 8 euro/hour ---- which was important for our teens. We could hear the noises from the room next door pretty easily --- and the staff doing dishes- making coffee right outside in the annex lobby each morning at the free breakfast --- but since we were always wanted to get up fairly early this was not a problem. Several times in Venice I felt we were conned in restaurants after ordering a large bottle of still water for the family to share --- I feel the waiter made a show of breaking the seal in his hand - - but the water inside seemed like right out of the faucet. Something to look for....

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: JamesfromTX
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 14 year old daughter, so had a triple room - room 401, right off the elevator, so the room was very nice and large. It had a great canal view and you could see the bell tower, the bell on another roof, the bridge of sighs (under reconstruction as of June 2011), and was a fabulous location. Pretty much seconds away from St. Marks and great shopping, dining, and sight-seeing. Bathroom and bedroom were both spacious. Room was nicely appointed, and the front desk staff was wonderful to us the whole time. Free breakfast was also about what you would expect - didn't blow us away, but certainly filled all the requirements quite nicely. Only negative comments are : 1) Free Wifi is only for 30 minutes, and only down in the lobby/lounge area. This turned out to be a good thing as it kept us from wasting all our time on facebook and we went out and explored instead :) 2) they offered a "grand canal tour" which picked us up right at the hotel's private dock - NICE! BUT! The guide only told us about a couple of things. Other than that, it was a taxi ride - which was great, but we were expecting a tour, with descriptions and history, etc. 3) It was a bit hard to find - make SURE you know where it is unless you get a taxi to take you directly there. We took the water bus and we had to search a bit (and then ask for directions) when my iphone GPS couldn't figure out where in Venice we were wandering. But we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and wouldn't hesitate to book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, very convenient,very clean”
Reviews.Author: kershawlaw
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi from Marco Polo airport which only took 20 minutes, wish it had taken longer! Very easy as the Hotel has its own docking. We were initally disappointed by our room size as we were in the annexe and it did feel slighly claustraphobic but we didn't spen too long there as the sites of Venice were right on our doorstep. The Hotel was spotless and the breakfaxt was very good. Watch out for the trip to Murano glass - we were tempted to buy a piece but found it was much cheaper in a shop at St Mark's square and their prices are infamous!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Fractalactic
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Colombina because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor and beacuse it seemed to be centrally located. We were not disappointed! Service was excellent both before and durng our stay. The concierge helped us (via email) with some fantastic restaurant recommendations and other bits of info before we left home. On arrival, the great service continued...nothing was too much bother for them. They changed restaurant reservations, gave us advice and maps and arranged a sunset cruise on the Grand Canal (we were allowed to take along a bottle of Prosecco!) The hotel is only a few minutes' walk from Piazza San Marco and on the same canal as the Bridge of Sighs. We opted for a Deluxe Room with a canal view which was lovely. The room (number 405) was tiny but perfectly formed. You had to be a bit on the neat side as there wasn't much space, but it was clean, the bed was firm and comfy and it had great views. Best of all, it had its own little roof-top deck with views over the whole of Venice. We enjoyed a few sundowners up there! Our room rate included breakfast...fairly standard fare but nicely presented and great service too. I would definitely go back to Hotel Colombina ....and ask for the same room :-)

Reviews.Title: “It's Offically-rated three-star,not four!! For that price and that kind of room and service, no, thank you!”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusUrbanLife
Reviews.Content: Let's face it. The entire city of Venice has a problem of rip-off their tourists. For $300/night, you don't have any scene, only a wall. Then when we asked whether we can get a room with a better scene, their poor-training staff told us that "because you booked thru Expedia, we cannot give you a better room". I believe anyone in American who has basic knowledge of service would know what's wrong with this type of response to hotel guests! Why not replace it with something like "sorry, but we are fully-booked now" or "the room upgrade is available upon extra payment, is this what you want", etc.. Then we made a mistake of let the hotel arrange a motorboat for us. We shared it with another couple and four old ladiesï¼Œ so total of 8 people although we were told it would be six people. Then our dear hotel staff told us that we have to pay hotel "cash only". This is ridicules! We were told they will give the cash to motorboat owner therefore cash is the only option. Think about it, we are their guests, they want us to pay 100 euros in cash! Regular price? Please, don't tell me the hotel itself will give 100% of our money to the boat owner. The best part if, then immediately when we aboard the boat, we found out that the price we paid is full-price without any discount. In that case, why do we need them to arrange it for us? We can simply walk out of the hotel, negotiate the price with boat owner directly, those motorboat and gondolas are everywhere! Anyway, we learned a lesson, so next day, we refused their offer of gondola, which is either 100 euro for my husband and I only, or share with another two couples and pay 30 euro each person. Then after two minutes walking outside the hotel, we found a deal, only 60 euros for us, not sharing with anyone! Like I said, don't take their offer on those stuff! Then, the annex room, although it's still cost nearly $300/night, the shower room is only 2 feet by 2 feet (yes, I did not spell wrong), without shelf to put our shampoo and other stuff. We had to keep the exhausting fan entire day, otherwise the room became very stink, quickly! Breakfast? Worst of the worst among the three hotels we stayed for this trip. The other two are in the $180-250 range, Rome and Florence. The night before we left, I made a collect call to American Express customer service. Before I made the call, I asked the front desk whether I will be charge any fees on collect calls. The answer is a very firm "no". However, the next morning, they won't let us leave unless we pay 3 euros for our "international call". No matter how we explained, they insisted we had to pay. I paid so I can get out of this ripping-off hotel. When I got home, American Express reimbursed me the money. However, this hotel had us double-paid for one call. It was on record, the call was an collect call which AE will pay them again! I totally think this hotel is over-rated! Oh, it's not four star like it claimed, I took a picture on the city official document that shows this hotel is only rated three-star!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ejavila
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. From our arrival by boat (what better way in Venice!) to our very comfortable room, to the awesome porters and Front Desk staff, to the exceptional location (meters away from St. Mark's Square). The staff at Hotel Colombina provided great service from the moment we arrived. Our room was right on the canal with one of only three (small) balconies overlooking the canal. The rooms were quiet, though we could hear a lot of chairs scraping across the floor above us (thankfully not too late at night) and very dark (with shutters closed and shades drawn) and the temperature was quite comfortable. Zero complaints and I would absolutely stay at this hotel when again in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice now and loved it”
Reviews.Author: ashleyjardine
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say that my wife and I are well traveled and extreamly fussy. We first stayed at the Colombina in August 2009 with our 7 year old son and found the Hotel Colombina the best hotel we have stayd at. This time my wife and I went to Venice on a business trip and the company we were with put us in another hotel. We went to the Colombina when we arived in Venice to see if we could book in as we didnt like the other hotel. As before the Colombina staff were extreamly helpfull and with short notice booked us into the same room we had before, room 201. This room over looks the canel from the bedroom and a balcony off the bathroom overlooking a garden court yard. We had many a wines on the balcony. Colombina is a very romantic Hotel and we will go back again. We have recomended friends and they had the same expirence. Well worth a stay and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: angelay17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying 2 nights in this fabulous hotel which we couldn't fault. We have paid alot more in other hotels in the past and not been as impressed. As others have said the location, staff and rooms are all fautless & the Buffett breakfast was all fresh food with a good choice. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and the staff are happy to recommend and make bookings. We took advantage of the private dock and took a water taxi back to the airport from the hotel which made a great end to our stay. I would disagree though with a couple of comments made by others. The staff are happy to make suggestions re taking trips etc but are not at all pushy if guests don't want to take these. In addition the furniture is designed to blend in with the rest of the decor which it does perfectly and elegantly rather than just being old and in need of updating which has been suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cap86
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and helpful staff made this hotel a pleasure to stay in. It is well located being within minutes of St. Mark's Square. We had a lovely, if small room with a balcony but were offered an upgrade to a superior room as our room had been specifically requested so moved to a larger room overlooking the canal - best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: PhilaRon
Reviews.Content: By any standard a great stay. Staff and hotel where excellent. Great location just two "blocks" of St Mark's Sq. On a canal.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, and staff so very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: nonenona
Reviews.Content: Charming Italian hotel just 2 minutes or less from San Marco square. Building is beautiful outside and in and situated on a canal. I emailed the hotel before trip and asked for directions to their hotel. A staffer wrote a long email back advising us of all the options available, which was faster, and giving approximate prices. They offered to answer any further questions we had. We chose the private water taxi; it was quick and pleasurable. Hotel arranged a gondola ride for us. Breakfast delicious (isn't Italian coffee the best?), and the room was beautiful. Opened my window, leaned on the balcony, and watched the canal traffic. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient Location”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteP2
Reviews.Content: Convinient location though it's hard to find the hotel from the train station. We were dropped off at St Marc Square station and even the police officer did not know where the hotel is. It's an old hotel but very clean, need to get some modern furnuture though. We were forced to check out at 10.00 AM instead of the regular check out at 12.00 noon because the hotel is sold out and have some early arrival that day, which is very inconvinient for us. Our train does not leave till 3.00 PM. It rained most of the time while we were there so the water smells like a sewer. March is not a good month to go to Venice because it rain most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant”
Reviews.Author: sharoncoggin
Reviews.Content: 5 Star Hotel. Service was excellent. Beautiful room. Did not want to leave. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: levinjoel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short distance from San Marco Piazza. We stayed in an annex room near the breakfast area (from which we didn't hear much noise in the mornings.) The room was excellent with an actual large bed (not just two twins pushed together) and even a couch and a large bathroom. The only problem we encountered was staff entering our room despite having a do not disturb sign on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Central yet quiet, elegant yet welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Ma_chi_sei
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little hotel... Practically next door to St. Mark's, but on a peaceful canal just up from the Bridge of Sighs (providing the occasional passing gondola for people-watching entertainment). The rooms aren't huge, but they're comfortable, elegant, and neat as a pin. What really makes this hotel stand out, however, is the staff, who are incredibly warm, welcoming, and helpful. Not to mention SO nice to kids -- my son's favorite part of Venice was hanging out at the concierge desk! They were all lovely, but I have to give a special shout-out to Paolo and Marco, both of whom have seemingly endless reserves of patience and affection for lively 5-year-olds. (Note to the child-averse: Don't worry, the Colombina is NOT overrun with screaming kids!)

Reviews.Title: “most comfortable bed ever !”
Reviews.Author: Teignview
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Columbina for 5 nights after our wedding, most comfortable mattress ever in a hotel and spotlessly clean room. All staff without exception lovely and really helpful with my pigeon italian!. We took the option of the hotel booked gondolar ride and found it very good value. Always professional staff around and the buffet breakfast was fresh and very appealing. Can not rate the hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and reasonable value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: kerh71
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in a great location just a couple of minutes walk from St Mark's Square. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. Our room did not have a canal view, but was a good size and clean, with a nice clean and quite spacious bathroom. The furniture in the room was a bit chipped but there was a stunning chandelier and the walls were covered in damask. Breakfast was served in a small dining room but there was a good choice of cold meats, bread rolls and pastries, yoghurt and limited fresh fruit (but it was March). Again, the waiting staff were helpful and there was plentiful tea, coffee and fruit juice. We did not eat any other meals in the hotel as you are so well placed to go out and explore the city. The best thing about the hotel was the location, my least favourite thing probably the slightly chipped furniture!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place....exceeding our expectations in every way”
Reviews.Author: Soniajayne
Reviews.Content: We arrived in St Marks Square after an hours trip on the ( 25e return ticket) waterbus from the airport. (avoid the taxis at 100e plus) On entering the square we were quickly shown the direction of the hotel by a local street seller. The hotel was situated up a side street and over a small bridge diagonally opposite to the clock tower. From the moment we checked in, everything was perfect. The room oozed venitian charm and being only a short distance from St Marks and Rialto Bridge we immediately felt part of the community. We fell in love with Venice. We had been told various horror stories about the smell, the prices and the street sellers, and yes it is expensive, and yes at times there was a slight aroma and the street sellers were a pain, but nothing could spoil the charm and beauty of the place. Some tips to bare in mind before you go......Gondola trips cost around 60e for two people (the hotel tried to sell us one for the same price, but sharing with 2 other couples) You need good shoes if you are to see all of Venice, we walked for a solid 7 hours the first day! Food and drink are expensive. An average meal, pasta with a beer and glass of wine costs at least 40e. All in all we would without hesitation recommend Venice and the Hotel Colombina for a fabulous break

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: romancuk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Service very good. Staff very helpful. Rooms a bit small, but very clean and cosy. Breakfast was nice. I would deffinetley go back. Loved Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!!”
Reviews.Author: Bex1523
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. The location was brilliant, just two minutes walk from St mark's square. Very classy and superbly clean rooms and the hotel in general was very grand. Staff were extremely friendly. Had a turn down service at night which was a nice surprise :) loved every minute of our stay and really did not qNt to leave

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: sylviagemperle
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect , close to the Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge. We made a great choise, the staff was friendly, principally Mr. Marco Ive who even tried to speak portuguese with us. The rooms are confortable and clean. My birthday was perfect in that place I'll never forget! Great city, hotel and people!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dickyholgate
Reviews.Content: very high standards,excellent hotel,very friendly staff,highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: bandbwilltravel
Reviews.Content: The location is second to none, just around the corner from most of the attractions. All the staff were polite, friendly & professional. Our room,410, was spacious, warm & spotlessly clean. The variety at breakfast was wide & plentiful. We will recommend this hotel to all our family & friends & we will certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory ( v.good location but everyhing else not good enough)”
Reviews.Author: lowroader
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Jan, location was good , however staff not very pleasant or helpful. First morning woke to sound of builders around 7:30am banging on walls in hotel ( not something you would expect from a 4 * hotel) Also breakfast was not as good as other hotels we stayed elsewhere ( fruit salad was stale to say it kindly).Rooms v. small & you could also hear people staying above so bring the ear muffs!! Staff highlighted on 2nd night that we were to be out by 11am, not even asking how we were finding our trip which was rude while the hotel TV channel said a 12 checkout time...... Also no irons and if u needed somethin pressed it would take 1/2 day plus 4.30 euro for a shirt or more..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, location, helpful and polite staff, definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: laus1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, brilliant location, 5 min walk from st marks square. Brilliant value gondola shared ride. Lovely breakfast with a wide variety. Couldnt recommend this hotel any more :)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: laura25_rigby
Reviews.Content: Ecellent service from all staff. Most speak some English. The room was very comfortable and very quiet. Everything was clean and well maintained (no frayed towels or bed linen). Warm and well lit, inviting to sit in communal areas to read newspaper. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my own family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike-x-K
Reviews.Content: Took my Wife to Venice for her birthday & had an incredible time, the hotel is located very close to St Marks square & lots of shops / restaurants. Marco along with his fellow concierges & all the other staff were extremely polite & very helpful, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Colombina”
Reviews.Author: John186313
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a break at the Colombina Hotel for my wifes birthday.Can I just say that we had an absolutely wonderful stay.The staff and the location were totally first class.If any body were considering a trip to Venice we would whole heartedly recommend this hotel.5 well deserved stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Experience”
Reviews.Author: boneisland79
Reviews.Content: On our recent stay, we had a delightful experience at the Hotel Colombina. Our room was decorated with antique furniture, fabric covered walls, a marble bath and shuttered windows opening on to a little used canal. There is a bridge over the canal almost at the hotel's doorstep that quickly leads to a street filled with restaurants and on to St. Marks Square and the Grand Canal. Breakfast offers a variety of things to eat in two well appointed dining rooms. The staff was courteous, helpful, and professional. Overall, we were happy with our choice of hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “friendly honest and great location”
Reviews.Author: cannes21
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time recently to celebrate a friends 80th birthday .I wanted comfortable accommodation in a quiet spot near St Marks square but with a mid range price. From pre checking confirmations to departure the hotel could not have been more helpful.The rooms looked over the canal and were spacious .They were traditional in style but without the heaviness you can sometimes get in Venice.I didnt see the suites but they look superb. Overall good value for money when you consider how expensive Venice is . St Marks was a 5 minute walk away and they arranged a brilliant 40 mins gondala ride and water taxi to the airport at a fair price.The staff were excellent.Nothing was too much trouble. Best of all when i arrived the previous guests had left a large sum of money for their holiday cruise in the safe by accident. I handed it to reception and they refunded it by Fed Ex to a very happy couple. Doesnt get much better than that these days.Im going back in the spring .

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very small rooms. No internet in room, and expensive in lobby.”
Reviews.Author: knwpsk
Reviews.Content: I had a mixed experience here. The place was nice enough, and the location is terrific -- a very short walk to San Marco square and the Grand Canal, etc. The staff treated us well and I thought the breakfast was fine (referring to another recent review). I agree - the sewage smell from the bathroom drains is not pleasant. We were on the top floor, so we could open the skylight in our bathroom, and this helped some. The bathroom was also TINY -- the "shower" was actually a hybrid bathtub in which one had to sit (not tall enough to stand, not long enough to lie down), and hold the shower hose over one's head to bathe! There is NO internet access in room at all. You have to pay 10 Euros an HOUR to use it in the lobby (try making Skype calls to your family from the lobby of a hotel!?!). Not happy about that. Our one real problem here was that we couldn't control the temperature in our room. It was hot (too hot to get under the covers and sleep), and they had switched the whole hotel over from A/C to heat the week before we arrived. Our only choice was to leave the outside window open all the time... and then listen to the church bells ringing ALL NIGHT. We didn't get a good night's sleep in Venice, ever, because of this. The staff was apologetic, but couldn't do anything about it. I understand the heating problem was a seasonal/temporary thing... but other hotels simply let you control the temp in your room independent of the rest of the building. All in all, I'm not upset with this hotel, and I wouldn't dissuade someone from staying there; but I will definitely look for other choices before I stay there again -- starting with free Internet access in room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Colombina was a big reason our trip to Venice was so perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TerryTup
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a beautiful surprise. The service was outstanding. Unlike other hotels we stayed in in Italy, we were never treated as foreigners. The language barrier we experienced in many places was non-existent here. To compliment that, the room was beautiful and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: redflower1978
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband got married on 30th of october and spent our honeymoon in Venice. The hotel he chose with his family was the hotel Colombina. The service was excellent and we have to thank specially 2 persons: Mr. Lorenzo and Mr. Marco for all the wonderful reception they gave to us. They were very friendly and kind to us. We also loved the hotel because it's close to the most touristics places and we had several places to visit and to eat. We also could learn some words: PREGO, ARRIVEDERCI, GRAZIE and BONJORNO. We will recommend this hotel to our family and friends as my husband's family recommended to us. We hope to come back again. Mr. and Mrs. Parrott. (Portugal) - room 301 (1st -8th November 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Charleston_SCSalty1
Reviews.Content: Out of a lovely trip around Italy, this hotel was the low point and the biggest disappointment. To start with the good. The location was good, it was just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's square and there was not much noise. The service provided by the Alessandro the bellmen and Alessandro at the Front Desk was very good. Now for the bad. We were put in a handicapped room and we were not handicapped. This in itself is not a big deal, but the amount of black mold in the bathroom was disgusting. When I asked at the Front Desk (we actually were dealing with the GM) about being moved to another room, we were told that we were assigned that room because one of us had recently had some surgery. Neither my wife or I have had surgery recently. My mother-in-law had surgery recently and was NOT in a handicapped room which was fine by her. Anyway we were showed 2 other rooms to see if we would want to move to for the rest of our stay, they both had extensive amounts of mold in their bathrooms too so I told the GM that we would not want to move as none of the other rooms were any better and requested that he get the mold taken care of in our room. They probably got about 50% of it only!! The arrogance and rudeness towards us by the General Manager was shocking to me, I guess he leads by example with the exception of the 2 previously mentioned employees. The lady serving breakfast, the other FD staff and the other bellmen seemed to follow their GM's poor example. During one of our afternoon walks we stumbled across a wine shop where we got a nice bottle of wine to enjoy before dinner and when my father-in-law asked if they had a corkscrew that we could use to open the wine, he was given quite a hard time and was told that he would have to ask the bar tender who told him that he would be charged. Eventually a bellmen came to the room with a bottle opener. This is just another example of the overall poor service. The breakfast was not good, the choices were slim. We booked a gondola ride through the hotel directly (DON'T MAKE THAT MISTAKE) and the price was significantly more than we could have got at any of the public areas. This was the only hotel out of the 6 hotels that we stayed in during our trip to Italy that we had to pay for the internet. There were no paper towels in the common area bathrooms to dry our hands with. The sheets on our bed were stained. We had to cover the drains in our bathroom to prevent the smell of sewer entering the room and I had to make a small barricade with towels to prevent water flooding the bathroom when we took a shower. All of these issues were brought up at some point to the staff during our trip and we didn't even get as much as an apology. We were not looking for a discount or anything in return, just some acknowledgement and concern to our needs. Only stay here if no where else has room for you.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable relaxed ideal position”
Reviews.Author: GmB84
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay in a hotel that was easy for main sights . The staff were extremely helpful and the room was spacious , very clean and a good atmosphere. Excellent breakfast buffet with great variety. Be prepared to walk in Venice. Eating out is very expensive and choice limited. Walk off main tourist track for best meals. Grand canal trip on ACTV is 6.50 Euros and best way to see sights. Gondolas are very expensive. Be prepared for at least half a day in Doges palace...lots of walking but well worth visit. Good views of San Marco square from terrace of Basilica 4 Euros. Coffee in square very expensive 15 euros. Trip from airport san marco by alilaguna 25 euro return takes 70 minutes each way but good. airport food good. Venice well worth a visit...tiring but an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely and Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: golfer56riverheadny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbina was recommended to us by our good friends. They stayed there three times. We requested and were given the same room overlooking the canal where the Bridge of Sighs is located. (and under repair). The room was beautiful and comfortable. The hotel has a cozy living room and charming bar area. We had drinks in either place each afternoon before going to dinner. If you spent 10 Euros on drinks, you could get 30 minutes of free wi-fi internet, which was great for us with our wi-fi phones! We thought the breakfasts, which were included in our stay, were delicious and nutritious. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is excellent; only a minute from San Marco and not far from the Rialto Bridge and Market. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & Very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: happycyprus
Reviews.Content: The hotel had come strongly recommended by friends. The hotel location is very well positioned for the main attraction's of Venice (Doge's Palace, Basilica & Piazza San Marco) and local restaurant's are plentiful. The hotel has the luxury of being directly accessable via the water cannel system. This allows water taxi's to bring you directly to the hotel front door from the airport, very cool. All the staff (reception & bar/ breakfast) were attentive and helpful. Good contential breakfast to get you going in the morning. Not Cheap but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Room with Music”
Reviews.Author: mstiversitaly
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the rooms on the first level that are right on the canal. Although, the rooms are smaller than those on the upper floors, it's so much fun to open the windows and watch all of the gondaliers coming down the canal. The staff is wonderful and the location is very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, beautiful roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: LostgirlBrighton
Reviews.Content: Most of what I read on trip advisor before booking was true, great location, clean, friendly, great service. We also got horribly lost trying to find the hotel, despite having already seen it from one of the canals - definitely print out the directions before you go! I had booked a standard room in the main building for our stay, but was really disappointed when I saw the room, it was a loft room and the ceiling was very low in parts, it felt really claustrophobic. The bathroom was hilarious, you couldn't stand up to have a shower (I am only 5ft 6) and had to sit in the bath instead! I lost count of the amount of times I banged my head, once really badly on the way out to the roof terrace. The room's private roof terrace is what saves it (and lets them get away with charging the price they do for it) as it is lovely, spacious, and you get an amazing view over the rooftops of Venice. You can also have breakfast on it for an additional 6 euros. Overall we were really pleased with the hotel, but I think they should have warned us about the room, and give people the choice over whether they want a roof terrace or to walk around without getting concussion!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel with clean facilities, friendly personnel and very nicely decorated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lali_miami
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my two year old daughter, my 14 and 18 years old nices and my husband. They were kind enough to put a crib in my room. The hotel also coordinates a free boat shuttle to the murano island, were they give you a demonstration of the murano glass. We were planning to take a tour, so the free water taxi and demonstration were very welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to Venice”
Reviews.Author: carolben
Reviews.Content: Sometimes the real hotel doesn't live up to expectations. Colombina exceeded ours! Gondolas really do pull up right in front. You really can see the Bridge of Sighs (under renovation) from the main door. And all just a few blocks from St. Mark's! Quiet at night, too. Hotel staff was warm and helpful, breakfast very nice, rooms absolutely beautiful, even those facing the inner courtyard. Only drawback was Internet service limited to the lobby, and even that often didn't work. Otherwise, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: voyageuseboreale
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little tricky to find walking from the San Marco Vaporetto â€˜stationâ€™; but nothing too serious. We appreciated the great location and the helpful and humourous staffâ€¦very welcoming and cheerful! There are 2 entrances to the hotel, one by foot (which crosses over a little bridge) and one by waterway. This hotel was very clean; our room was very spacious as was the bathroom. The room had a fridge and a separate area for the closet and luggage rack. The bathroom had a big deep tub with detachable shower-head handle that rested on the side of the tub; however there was neither a shower nor a shower curtain. I had to place towels on the floor to take a Neanderthal-style shower, as the water would spray onto the floor. Also, we did not find the A/C to be efficient at keeping the room cool, which made for a warm nightâ€™s sleep. I found a creepy-crawly in the tub on the 1st day (I am completely bug phobic); which prompted me to take the quickest showers of my life. Given that Venice sits on water, Iâ€™m sure this is inevitable. We kept the tub plugged at all times and didnâ€™t see anymore the rest of the trip (my Dad always says that bugs donâ€™t know and donâ€™t care if a hotel is a 4 star hotel). Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venetian - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveholsHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd hotel we stayed in during our 3 week trip to Italy, we stayed for 4 nights. We arrived by private transfer water taxi from the station, very smooth and a wonderful way to enter Venice and immerse oneself. I was very surprised by our room which was spacious enough for the three of us, classical decor, lovely glass chandelier, marble bathroom, small balcony over the canal and a bonus terrace leading from the bathroom - this really made it for me. As you view the hotel from across the bridge our room was on the first floor, right of building overlooking canal & bridge. From one of our front windows you could lean out and see the Bridge of Sighs (sadly obscured by advertising hoardings). Staff distant and desk staff verging on cold - but they became very friendly when selling us an overpriced shared gondola trip on our last night. The hotel is somewhat claustrophobic i.e. there isn't anywhere to go other than your room or a tiny bar or lounge - but as we spent everyday doing as much as we could this wasn't important. However, our 12 year old daughter wasn't impressed with the lack of English speaking channels - 1 in total! Probably not the right choice for teenagers. Breakfast room no windows but very inventively frescoed, not enough tables for guests and very poor quality/choice of breakfast - most definitely on the mean/cheap side. However, given all of that I would still say it's a good place to stay so long as you aren't interested in food or hotel facilities as the location is absolutely perfect and I did enjoy the noise every morning at the crack of dawn as the boats start to deliver their goods and in the evenings we were serenaded by the gondolas.

Reviews.Title: “No Internet, Barking Concierge”
Reviews.Author: amschitaly
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate because the owner of our previous hotel called. So we had a large room and nice view which seems to be a problem in other reviews. Strangely though the faucet in the sink wasn't far enough away from the counter to actually land completely in the sink so we created a dam with towels. I agree though that the concierges were often biting -- I felt like I was being reprimanded until finally we'd had enough and turned a little biting ourselves. Biggest complaint: NO INTERNET. So we had to walk to their sister hotel which was "five minutes" away. It was of course much farther. On the plus side, we didn't have to pay for it and the fees looked whopping. Next time I'm going to buy an internet device from Tom or Tim (one of those tech companies in Italy) and save myself all this hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChuffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights & the location is absolutely fantastic. If you arent staying in venice for a long time & want to be near the main sights then stay here. The reception staff were very nice & friendly although occasionally they tried to sell excurisions to glass factory & tried to sell us a gondola ride (with another couple) for 30 euro telling us that if we didnt we would expect to pay 130 euro which was rubbish as we managed to get one for ALOT less right outside the hotel. Located VERY close to St Marks & lots of restaurants & bars. The hotel was expensive but very clean but our room was the smallest room I have ever been in & it had a tiny window which looked out on to a wall. Luckily we dont spend much time in hotel rooms when on a city break but it would of been nice to have a nicer view (or even a larger room) but I suppose we paid for the price. Breakfast was served between 7-10 & include alot more than I thought. I had the most amazing coffee and we were able to help ourselves to crossiants, cheese, ham, cereals, juices & lots more. I can imagine that alot of hotel rooms in Venice are the same so I would recommend this hotel but purely for the location. We booked this hotel through Expedia who on their website say that this hotel has a roof terrace - IT DOES NOT - it is their sister hotel which is not located near by! Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here --- You will not be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: Vail2Italy
Reviews.Content: I'm a little reluctant to spread the news of how fabulous the Hotel Colombina in Venice is, as the prices will probably increase, or I won't ever be successful at booking in the future! Having said that, the hotel really deserves high reviews on every count. I checked in a little after 1:30 p.m. and my room was ready. It was large, spotlessly clean and beautifully furnished, with a full Murano glass chandelier hanging from the ceiling. It had a beautiful balcony overlooking a small side canal where the gondoliers would ferry their passengers around. The bathroom, again spotless, was marble and huge, with a large bathtub. The room (Room 203) is also quite large. (The rooms in the "03" line seem to be premium rooms.) The air conditioning worked perfectly and no issues whatsoever with water, either pressure or amount. And did I mention how quiet it was at night? Unbelievable to be so close to all the sites and yet have such a quiet sleeping experience. The location is perfect. Just a short 5 minute walk from St. Mark's square, which is a blessing in Venice with luggage. It's easy to find. Breakfast was good, with bread, croissants, cereal, fruit, meats, cheese, yogurts and juices, as well as coffee or tea. It was all served with a smile and breakfast extends until 10:30 so you can sleep late. Also, eggs and other hot fare are available for a very reasonable additional charge (eggs cost 3.5 Euros). The staff were very accommodating. I get up early and did not want to wake others, so went down for coffee first, then later came back from breakfast --- no problem at all. The staff at the hotel were all professional, pleasant and helpful. Every request was easily taken care of and I was made to feel welcome. I loved the movie channel, since I've been in Italy for a month and have not seen any English TV at all, but it does show the same movie on repeat every few hours. All in all, a great experience and I did not want to leave. The last time I was in Venice, I stayed at the Luna Baglioni at three times the cost. The Colombina, while not as luxurious, is every bit as nice and just as good a location. I would definitely book again here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, friendly and helpful and room 503 is brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Stan2500
Reviews.Content: After a trip on the Orient Express we thought we had experienced the ultimate in luxury, until we arrived at the Hotel Colombina and were introduced to our suite 503. A room with every facility you could wish for including a room terrace with a view over the roof tops of Venice, bliss on a hot summers evening. The staff we friendly and we had a long conversation with the pleasant bar man. The staff on reception we also fiendly and helpful and gave us good advice on eating out. The visit was for 1 night only and we wished we had been staying longer. There is no doubt we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent hotel with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: robotron
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by very friendly staff. The hotel was immaculate, and our suite was spacious. The location was perfect; it was right on a canal. Marco at the front desk was very helpful and always willing to recommend restaurants and sites. We will surely come back to the Colombina Hotel again in the future. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A rooftop view of the canal...."”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our honeymoon in Venice, early June 2010. My new husband had stayed at the Colombina Hotel before and appreciated it's charm, as well as the good location. He reserved a room for us, securing the only one that had a rooftop terrace and view of a canal (there is another room with a terrace, but no canal view). The room was small, but very nicely appointed. The staff was extremely pleasant, very accommodating and their command of the English language was very good (nice, since we speak very little Italian). They even recommended a couple of very nice restaurants which were nearby and not too expensive. The only negative was the firmness of the bed - after 3 nights we were glad to give our backs a rest!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: reidthesailor
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Colombina. The small size meant the service was incredible, friendly, and very personal. The rooms were very clean and very nice, decorated in a Venetian style. Some rooms overlook a small canal, where it's fun to watch the gondolas and taxis drive by, or get picked up by one right at the hotel doorstep. The walls are also about a foot thick, so once you close your door it's impossible to hear anything from outside; I slept like a baby. The hotel is located 30 seconds from the Piazza San Marco, Venice's tourist center, so there are a thousand tiny, delicious restaurants, plenty of great shopping, and hundreds of incredible tourist destinations within walking distance from the hotel. Marco and Lorenzo, the two coolest hotel managers/concierges in the world, helped us find great restaurants and shops and attractions every day during our stay, and they helped us stay updated on the world cup! The rooms were great, the service was great, and the location was great. We couldn't have been happier with our stay and we had a lot of fun. Thanks Hotel Colombina!

Reviews.Title: “delightful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentMrsW
Reviews.Content: Our room (and the rest of the hotel) was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean, with shuttered windows opening onto a pretty, quiet canal. The turn-down service each evening was a nice touch . Breakfast was plentiful with a variety of rolls, juices, fruit, cheese etc and hot coffee or tea.
