Reception staff are friendly, efficient and welcoming. There is a cosy small bar where you can read the papers and enjoy a drink. It is located about 5 minutes from St Marks Square and , although tricky to find initially, full instructions are given on website. No hesitation about returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: BeanCounter003
Reviews.Content: Recently ended cruise in Venice and stayed here. Absolutely loved it. I found/chose this place by mistake. A friend who had been to Venice told me this was where she stayed and loved it later realizing it was where her TA had tried to get her a room but it had no vacancy so she'd actually stayed somewhere else . In any case, we loved the hotel. It was very near St Mark's Square which is absolutely gorgeous. The room was had the most gorgeous chandelier. Loved the bathroom also. When I was looking to book a hotel, they had very competitive rates so got the room for what I thought to be a good price considering this is Venice and everything is so expensive. I would most definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Not Satisfied with Hotel Options”
Reviews.Author: Kimkay
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms at Hotel Colombina in advance and requested rooms side by side. When we arrived they gave us one dingy room that smelt with no view and the room was very warm. My husband did not want to stay here. The second room was larger but also looked like it hadn't been used much. We went to the front desk and requested another room. The only suitable room for my husband and myself was two floors up and at an extra cost of 80 euro per night. They could not accomodate rooms side by side that were suitable. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything - Perfect for Carnivale”
Reviews.Author: LiveTaTravelOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family (husband and 2 yo) in Feb 2010, not realising it was carnivale time. The room was kept clean and the concierge was amazing. The hotel desk staff helped us out with restaurant recommendations (as we had a two year old and didn't want to go to a no-children type restaurant but still wanted top notch cuisine). On Valentines Day eve they organised a babysitter for us at the last minute so we could have a meal on our own. They organised water taxi transport for us where ever we wanted to go. This hotel is close to the St. Marco's square, a 5 minute walk to these cafe's restuarants, shops, and also little convenience type stores where we could stock up on bottled water, snacks etc. It felt like we were in the center of all the action/attractions going on for carnivale - but we were a stones throw away from our room if we wanted to retreat for a rest. My only annoyance was the movie channel - but hey you don't go to Venice to lounge around and watch movies. The same movie seemed to be on repeat for 3 - 4 days non-stop. A minor issue but sometimes it was too cold to go out with our two year old so in the room we rested. I read some reviews here that said water was an issue - not once did we have a problem with high water - and we had a stroller to struggle with too. In the square of course the water is quite high - requiring boots/plastic water bags over your boots but around the hotel we were fine. Venice is Venice as we all know and the water is an issue but thats all part of the experience. We really felt this hotel was perfect for a family who wanted to be close to it all - close enough if you need to get back to the room for a rest/toddler time. The staff were spot on with their recommendations for restaurants to suit us too - we had great meals/service without feeling like we shouldnt have brought our tantrum toddler with us into the restuarant - which made it very stress free. The beds were comfortable - as with most hotels in Europe they were single beds pushed together. We didn't have a room with a view over the canal but I would recommend one as its all part of the venetian experience. It was also nice having the bar/sitting room right near the door for the water taxi as you can have a drink/coffee while you wait for your taxi boat. It took about 20 mins for our water taxi to take us from the train station in Venice to our hotel, and it took about 35 mins for our water taxi to take us to the Venice Airport. The hotel does organise a day trip to Murano glass - obviously a deal between the two organistions, however the hotel will not pressure you to go. I think its worth the trip as you do get a great display of the glass blowing art and the museum/shop is worth a look too. Sure they put the hard sell on you - but if your confident and don't want to buy anything just say so - be blunt and polite and go outside and wait for the taxi to come and get you. We only brought two fish - small items as everything in there was very expensive - hard to find anything under $500 even for a tiny thing. We are very happy with what we got as (it shut the sales person up quickly) and also we have lovely lovely glass souveneir of our trip to the Murano Glass factory in Venice. You only live once and this was our only "big" buy in Venice. The staff at the Columbina were great - as we were only meant to stay 3 nights we ended up staying 6 - during the busiest time of the year for them. They were very helpful, genuine guys and I would recommend this hotel to a young family any time. I have included some photos so you can see its a very opulent room - even for a standard room without a canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian elegance”
Reviews.Author: Loragirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two days whilst on a short break in Venice. The room was extremely clean, updated and tastefully decorated in Venetian style which I really loved. The only small negatives were that it was rather dark and a little small. Also the bed was very hard but by the second night I had got used to this and had a good nights sleep. It would have been useful for tea/coffee making equipment to have ben provided. However there were many more plusses than negatives. The staff are extremely helpful, friendly and professional. We had a lovely chat with the barman one evening â€“ what a friendly man! A concierge helpfully gave us directions to a recommended restaurant for a good fish supper. The breakfast room is warm and welcoming and the breakfast provided was absolutely fine. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service in wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Wolfpack_Lamb
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was fantastic. The rooms were clean, well maintained, and a good size for a hotel in Venice. The people at the front desk were very helpful in making reservations, giving directions, providing recommendations, and providing assistance in anyway possible. We stayed two nights for our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The hotel is located on a quiet canal and side street, but is very close to all the sights. It was a little hard to find the hotel, but if you haven't been to Venice you will soon learn everything is hard to find and that is half the fun. When I find myself in Venice again I will make sure to check to see if there is availability at this hotel before looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice room and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nicolafb
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to this hotel by a friend who had stayed there. it didn't rate that highly on trip advisor but I took a chance and I was very pleased I did. The location is great. Relatively easy to find and fronts onto one of the side canals which is lovely. It is very peaceful and you could get a water taxi from the airport right to the door if you wanted to. I paid for a canal view and we were lucky enough to get a top floor room so we had a great view. At night we opened the window and looked out onto the canal and across the roof tops of Venice which was really lovely. The room itself was large and comfortable. A few little things to pick at such as the toilet seat which was broken and we ran out of toilet roll towards the end of our stay but these were minor points. Breakfast was included and was very good. Selection of meats, cheese, yoghurts, fruit with orange juice and coffee. The bar looked quite sweet but we didn't use it. The only night we might have done it was closed. It seemed to close quite early as this was a Saturday night and only about 11.15pm. One very nice touch was that it was my husband's birthday whilst we were there and they must have spotted it on his passport as on the day he was given a prettily done up pack of Italian biscotti style biscuits for his birthday. A really nice touch. I felt very relaxed in this hotel. It was comfortable and well located and I would definitely stay there again if I visited Venice. Although beware visiting Venice in February. The evenings were a struggle - not much open (particularly on Sunday night and even Monday) and very quiet. Probably better to visit in the Spring when things might be a bit more lively.

Reviews.Title: “Colombina â€“ I like your style!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleJeanPierre
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do donâ€™t stay in an overpriced hotel along the Grand Canal when you can stay at the Colombina. Located just a hop, skip and a jump away from St Peterâ€™s Square in the heart of the city it is excellently located down one of the quiet narrow alleyways overlooking a proper, authentic Venetian waterway. All the staff I encountered, from reception to bellboy to restaurant, was friendly and efficient. It was my birthday while I was there and they had even taken the trouble to note that this was the case from my passport; presenting me with authentic Italian biscuits at breakfast. Nice touch Colombina â€“ I like your style! I stayed in a fourth floor (2nd floor from top) canal view room (worth upgrading if you can get it) which was clean and spacious and looked out over the rooftops of the city â€“ I could almost imagine Dick Van Dyke singing chim-chiminy. The bathroom was large, well lit with a good amount of mirrors (actually the whole hotel is a little obsessed with mirrors so if you donâ€™t like your face be prepared for depression to set in) and the bed was firm but comfortable. Itâ€™s a very quiet and peaceful place to stay even with the window open. But if you want everything to be perfect then this place might annoy you: sometimes breakfast tables werenâ€™t cleared quickly for the next sitting; the toilet seat kept breaking; and the lift was out of action one evening. These are small things that didnâ€™t bother me because, frankly, all the good bits far outweighed the bad (which were few). Venice is pretty damn quiet in February and bars and restaurants seemed to close abnormally early. Top tip â€“ better to visit at the end of the week or the weekend, or in the springtime (never the summer â€“ the crowds will kill you). But whatever time you visit I would recommend the Colombina as your home for the duration.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent......”
Reviews.Author: waxie01
Reviews.Content: Our 10 day trip to Venice was made all the nicer by staying at the Hotel Colombina with a friendly, very helpful team at the hotel. Nothing would be too much trouble as they aim to please and succede. This was our 4th year running to Venice and have only stayed at the Hotel Colombina. Would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: eandh_Dublin
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Venice. The hotel was terrific (and very good value), close to Piazza San Marco (less than three minutes) and with a view of the Bridge of Sighs (sadly blanked off by a screen when we were there) and the back of the Ducal Palace, set on a canal and bridge with its own small dock for water taxis and gondolas. The staff were very courteous and friendly, our room was charming if somewhat overheated (there is a thermostat so you can control the heating yourself) and the breakfast room (and breakfast) were delightful. Contrary to one review there is a lift although it does not go to the fifth floor (where there is only one room). One recent reviewer noted the difficulty of getting to the hotel when there is a high tide and, yes, water taxis canâ€™t get to the hotel dock if the canal is flooded. However, it is actually very easy to get to (dry-shod) from the waterfront. From the airport: take the Alilaguna Blue Line (â‚¬13pp; it takes 1hour 10minutes; turn left outside arrivals and follow the covered walkway to the docks for the Alilaguna and water taxis, it does take seven minutes). If you get off at S. Zaccaria you have the option of going through Piazza S. Marco (the scenic route) or, quicker and dry underfoot if thereâ€™s a high tide (flooding at least part of the Piazza and requiring you to negotiate the narrow raised board walks: if the water is lapping onto the quay at S. Zaccaria then S. Marco is flooded). Cross the first two canals going towards S. Marco (turn left along the waterfront: each of the bridges has a gentle ramp) and take the narrow street (150m: Calle dei Albanese) on your right (if this is your first visit to Venice you will soon realise that Albanese is actually quite spacious!). (If you arrive at Zaccaria by vaporetta from the train station you cross just one bridge.) Straight up to a small square (100m from the waterfront) and straight through this (15m) to the lane (Calle de la Chiesa) on the far right corner. You come to a church (50m: S. Giovannt in Oleo/ Nouvo) on your left: turn left immediately past this and you come into another small square (20m). Take the far right-hand (covered) lane (20m: Fondamenta de Rimedio) and you come onto a small bend in a narrow canal (on your right): take the first left (20m: Calle del Rimedio) and youâ€™ll see a bridge at the far end of the lane. The Colombina (40m) is on your left immediately before the bridge. If it takes you more than five minutes (415m) youâ€™ve been walking very slowly!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cdgibbons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I escorted a group of 40 guests of various ages from 45 to 80 to Venice in early October 09 and stayed at the Hotel Columbina for a pre night stay to a cruise that we were all going on. I contacted Marco approximately a year prior to our arrival and he was without a doubt one of the most gracious hosts that I have worked with from the very beginning of our planning all the way through to our stay at the hotel. Marco had arranged private water taxi's for all our guests and met us on his own time at the airport to insure that the transfer to the hotel went seamlessly. He personally put all our luggage on board the water taxi's making it a very pleasant experience for our guests. Our guests loved just walking off the water taxi and directly into the hotel. Hotel staff met each water taxi with warm smiles and an incredible welcome and manged getting all luggage marked and delivered to our rooms without any isses. All hotel reservations were completed by Marco prior to our arrival and room keys were handled in an expedient manner. Our rooms were very comfortable and beautifully arranged with lovely Venitian furniture, drapes and matching bed linens that you would expect in a 4 star hotel. Marco pre arranged private gondola rides for our guests in the latter part of the afternoon, followed by a great cocktail reception enjoyed by all in their lovely lobby area. Later that evening we all enjoyed an exceptional Venitian dinner with entertainment at one of the oldest Venice Restaurants within a five minute walk of the hotel again all personally arranged by Marco. In the morning we all enjoyed the lovely breakfast buffet prior to prearranged water taxis picking us up for a transfer to the ships terminal. I give the Hotel Columbina a 5+ review overall but would like to give Marco a special recognition for all he did to make our stay perfect in every way. We cannot wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION!”
Reviews.Author: wrantar
Reviews.Content: At high tide you definitely will not be able to take a water taxi to or from this hotel. This is because there are 2 low bridges between the Grand Canal and the hotel's dock. If it is raining or, worse, if the streets are flooded and you must use the series of duck boards to get from St. Mark's to the Columbia, you should be aware that these temporary walkways are not continuous and you will have to take your luggage down from one set of boards and hoist up on to the next set of boards at 3-4 intersections. The board walkways are narrow and crowded with people. The elderly, handicapped and those with more than one bag will find this challenging. If your bags do not have wheels will be impossible to make this travel. Finally, when you do arrive near the hotel you will have to haul the bags up and then down a final bridge. Finally, several of the late afternoon evening staff exhibited an attitude of indifference to rudeness. I restate here the comment of another trip advisor reviewer who was more eloquent than I "I found the reception that evening to be somewhat unfriendly and cool. Throughout our stay we received inconsistent attitudes from the reception desk, though they were mostly frosty and aloof throughout or visit. The bellhop, however, was very friendly and helpful. I also liked the cleaning staff" .The hotel does have an elevator --- was another reviewer thinking of the adjoining facility?Otherwise, my comments would be in line with the pluses and minuses mentioned by other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Charming Room”
Reviews.Author: Scrumptious29
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and it was our fist time in Venice and we were on our honeymoon. I was immediately pleased by the Hotel's location. It is lierally diagonally right behind St. Mark's square...anyone who has 'complained' about lugging their luggage from the 'port' to the hotel is unrealisitic. We landed in Venice during high tide...the water was literally up to our chins and my husband had to lug our two huge suitcases on the narrow walking platforms that are erected during high tide. We tackled this and never once felt inconvenienced...as this is part of the 'adventure' when travelling. We stayed in room 405, which is a short flight up from the elevator. I was so impressed with the room...yes, the room is slightly small...but isn't everything in Europe? The cieling of our room was all wood with a post and beam pattern and we had a nice terrace overlooking all of Venice (you could see mountains to the North on a clear day) and the domes of St. Mark's and the Bridge of Sighs. I found the hotel to be a perfect location in terms of feeling as though you're in the 'bustle' of the city without it being too crowded....keep in mind we were there from October 22 - 25, so towards the end of tourist season. Some reviews have commented on the bathrooms and how they had to crouch down? I'm 5'10" and although the shower/bathtub combination has an 'interesting' sit-down bench thingy...the main platform of the actual shower is plenty tall and I didn't need to adjust the height of the actual shower head. My husband and I didn't really use the services of the Hotel...so we can't really comment on the breakfast, internet service or stuff like that. But our room was always clean when we returned from our day and the hotel staff was friendly and always answered any question(s) we had. They even provided us with a very nice umbrella because it was raining quite hard one night when we were heading out for dinner. All in all, I would stay at this hotel, over and over and over again. I'm the type of person that has no expectations when travelling...and both my husband and I take any inconvenience that comes our way as an interesting experience and a story to tell others when we get back. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but not Fab!”
Reviews.Author: makethatalargeone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by some travellers we met in the summer. We had an excellent room with a small terrace - a great bonus in the summer but not much use in November - however no one to blame but myself on this one. All in all a good stay but cannot say that I would rave about it and probably will not go back. Rather expensive for what it is - but I guess that is what you get in Venice. We had a dinner recommendation for our first night - did not ask for any more after that! Well situated for St Mark's etc but could probably do better a little further away form the centre

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was beautiful, but kind of difficult to get to”
Reviews.Author: Erinkk00
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice, and we are not sure how other hotels would compare. But overall, we found it challenging to lug our bags to the hotel from the port, having to cross over multiple briges with lots of steps. We could have taken the water taxi directly to the hotel's front door from the airport, but that would have cost approx. 90 euro. The hotel itself was beautiful and charming, but no elevators. Again, if you are travelling with heavy luggage, this is a challenge. The rooms were kind of small, but cozy. I would expect that is the norm in Venice. The breakfast was enjoyable and the dining room was nice. The hotel offered free shuttle service over to Murano (but not back), and also tried to organize other outings for the guests, too. The best thing about Colombina is that it's quite close to St. Mark's square. overall, we had a pleasant stay, but would probably try to find somewhere closer to the port next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff, Rooms could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: swanneyCanada
Reviews.Content: Not sure about the 4 star standing. Although it was quiet and was in a great location, the rooms were very tiny and the wallpaper looked like it had seen better days. The buffet was decent, and the staff were very helpful. The internet fees were over the top. It was the only place during our 3 week European vacation where we had to pay for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room but beware the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Robocop1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is blessed with a great location being close enough to St Marks Square to visit within minutes but equally tucked away enough to be away from the crowds. It even had its own entrance for private taxis and gondolas. The service was very friendly and helpful and they were able to answer any questions or queries I had. The room we had was effectively an attic conversion and was a change from most hotel box rooms with the corner being walled off as the bathroom. The room had wooden beams and a nice bed ( which was turned down for you each evening with a card telling you what the weather would be like the following day!) plenty of mirrors and nice furniture with a plasma TV in the corner and the usual exorbitantly priced minibar and a safe which does not have to be paid for ( although ours was not in best working order and took several attempts to lock each time it was opened). Also there were no tea/coffee making facilities. There was also not much wardrobe space to hang up clothes However the bathroom really was of little use to anyone over F5'00 due to where it had been built within the hotel. The bath is the smallest one I'd ever seen and had a raised area to sit on and you could not stretch out your legs. Likewise you could not stand up in it either and a shower head attachment was provided for use as you sat in the bath. Equally if you stood at the washbasin you'd be unable to see your face in the mirror unless you crouched down or were under F5'00 tall. The room was on the 5th floor but the lift only went to the 4th and there was a short flight of steps to the room. It was climbing these stairs that you noticed it suddenly getting warmer and warmer and when you got into the room it was incredibly hot. Consequently you needed to turn on the air con. Incredibly this was not available as I was told that it was switched off as an energy saving measure in Winter which is all very commendable except when you try and sleep at night. In the end we had to leave the window open and when I woke up in the morning I had been bitten innumerable times by whatever insects had visited the room that night. It was this infortunately that marred an otherwise highly enjoyable break. Judging by other reviews I think we just pulled the short straw with this particular room as all else aside it was clean and in its own way quite cosy. If I stayed there again I think I'd ask for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: geoheim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex and our room was extremely small - not enough room to open both our suitcases at the same time. From reading other reviews it sounds as though rooms in the main building were more spacious. That aside, everything else was very good. The bed was comfortable, the decor was nice and the bathroom and shower were fine. The breakfast included with the stay in the annex was also very nice. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful and the proximity to St. Marks Square was a definite advantage. We took the free water taxi from the hotel to Murano (provided by one of the glass factories there). They take you on a tour of the glass-blowing facility and then their store (pressure to buy some of their wares was not too strong). Afterwards we spent several very enjoyable hours wandering around Murano which was a very nice experience. We would definitely go back to the Colombina on our stay in Venice but would spend the extra money for a room in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JudyKChicago
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in September. It was our first stop in Italy and US Air lost my luggage. The staff was exterememly helpful in making all of the necessary calls for tracking purposes. We were so tired when we arrived, they also refreshed our towels after we showered--they typcially don't do that until the next day. Then, I left my reading glasses behind, which they sent on to our next stay. I was very appreciative off their efforts to make our stay pleasant despite my lost luggage, which I did receive before we left. The hotel is in a great location, just behind St. Marks Square and just a five minute walk from the vaporetta station at S. Marks. The rooms in the annex are small, but the bathrooms have great showers. The breakfast for guests in the Annex is very adequate. I would stay there again. It's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “This is an outstanding, memorable hotel and staff !!”
Reviews.Author: Tex1000
Reviews.Content: A 10 -- great location, wonderful room (303 or 306 -- can't recall) on Canal with two small balconies. Great staff - Alexandro, Marco & Lorenzo. Made our stay the best of Venice, Rome and Florence, after a good stay in Florence and a disapointing stay at the de Russie in Rome. I can't say enough good things, nor could my lady friend. David from Houston

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DWCTexas
Reviews.Content: After some difficulty in finding the hotel (even with printed directions), it turned out to be quite a surprising gem. The staff was very helpful and pleasant and everyone spoke English well. Ask for room 406---it is a cozy little room with skylights and a terrace. Would stay here again---convenient to the plaza and the basilica. Spent a couple of rainy evenings in the bar with the bartender "Vinny" and enjoyed his company very much.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask anything to the concierge”
Reviews.Author: betty49yuk
Reviews.Content: We asked for a restaurant suggest from a friend of us and they told me "don't go there!" trying to push us in another place. Of course we decide to follow the suggestion of our friend and we had a splendid evening with great food and charming service. Now I can understand that a concierge can have a tip from some places but I think also when a guest ask for a place they must call and make your reservation especially in a four stars hotel. I hope not all the concierge in Venice are like "La Colombina".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCanada
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the hotel but they forgot to give us our passports back. When we realized it, they took NO responsibility for the oversight, and would not help pay for the 500 Euro emergency courier fee they charged to bring our passports to the border crossing into Croatia. if it weren't for that, we would have gone back. Buyer beware, and do not rely on them to return your passport. Signed, Happy but broke!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: geoo
Reviews.Content: Colombina Hotel is a very good 4 star hotel. The location is perfect. The hotel lies very close to Saint MarkÂ´s Square and you can see the bridge of sighs from the waterfront entrance of the hotel. I can really recommend to take a private taxi-boat to the hotel when arriving from the airport. The taxi-boats stops right outside the hotel. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We booked our room (standard, breakfast included) on the hotel internet site and got a very good deal. Our room had a high ceiling with a venetian chandelier hanging above the bed. The room was well-sized, quiet and tastefully decorated in the classic venetian style and had a flat screen tv. The wardrobe had a safe inside and big mirrors on the doors. We never booked a canal view room so the view from the window was not very breathtaking. The room had a spacious bathroom with a bathtub and was nice decorated with a big mirror above the sink and a big mirror on the bathroom door. The breakfast (juices, fresh fruit, croissants, yoghourts,cake etc) was good, not huge but plenty. When served coffee or tea you always got your own silver plated coffee pot which was a nice treat. We were very happy with our stay at the Colombina hotel and when we go back to Venice we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A romantic gem”
Reviews.Author: jamboLondon_England
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely hotel in a great location and with very friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble! Treat yourself to a water taxi from the airport and arrive at the hotel's canalside entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Cinderella Story”
Reviews.Author: SweetTpie10s
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my boyfriend in early September. Amazing hotel with superb service. Venice is a gorgeous city except for it is swamped with tourists from 9 am until 6 pm..The hotel looked like it was out of a Cinderella movie..Excellent breakfast...Rooms were very nicely decorated..amazing experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful - a true pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SomersetOscar
Reviews.Content: The Colombina is within two minutes walk of St Mark's Square, and within 150 metres of the Bridge of Sighs, which is visible from the hotel's own landing stage. Tastefully decorated throughout, the bedrooms are very comfortable and well appointed. We were made very welcome despite arriving very late at night - the staff are, without exception, helpful and friendly and nothing seems to be too much trouble. The Continental Breakfast provided is more than adequate to set one up for the day. A nice touch is the variety of international newspapers available daily in the hotel lounge. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay (our second) and will definitely book into the Colombina again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Miareuben
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and location and all we could have possibly wished for. We had a room with a canal view which was just beautiful. The staff were very helpful with all our inquiries and the breakfasts were very good and served in a delightful dinning room. We were so close to all the attractions in Venice and spent our three days walking everywhere. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would not even consider looking for alternate accommodation when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Belissimo xxx”
Reviews.Author: DubaiAmanda
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel in a great location right near St Mark's Square but tucked away so as not to be disturbed by noise or pedestrians. The staff were fabulous and as it was just myself and my mum suggested we shared a gondola ride, which they organised, with other guests in order to save us money. They also organised a wonderful trip to Murano for us in a private speedboat for free. Murano is well worth a visit. DO NOT LEAVE once you have been to the glass factory....you must stay and visit the little town on the island. It is wonderful and much less busy then Venice. The hotel has a private launch and its perfect to sit on the bench outside watching the gondalas pass whilst enjoying a Bellini or two! The hotel was spotless and decorated in traditional venetian style. The only thing that let our room down was it was in the attic and quite small and the views although good were not over the canal. Also the bathroom was tiny, we couldn't stand in the shower!!! but it was all good fun and it would not put us off going back at all I would definately return. We did get a cheap deal so this could well be why we had the small room as I know some of the others were huge. It was my mum's 60th and she loved every minute of her stay at the Colombina and in Venice ... enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: JustGotBack14
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was just perfect. We stayed in the Deluxe Double Room and were amazed at its beauty. It overlooked a canal and had an awning over the balcony. The chandelier was beautiful and the room was beautifully decorated. The staff was professional.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Purple11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, spacious room with updated bathroom (double sinks). The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast and bar service both good. It had an intimacy that some of the larger hotels lack. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff, and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: ABP23
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was conveniently located two short streets off St. Mark's Square on the Bridge of Sigh's Canal. Very comfortable room, good breakfast, and the staff very helpful. Front desk booked Murano tour, gondola ride- picked up at hotel dock- so convenient. Only stayed two nights but best visit to Venice yet.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis steps from piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Ayerman38
Reviews.Content: Our beautiful, large room overlooked quiet canals only about 3 minutes from the hoards in San Marco piazza. Murano glass chandelier, silk-covered walls, beautifully appointed modern bath, ample storage, powerful air-conditioning. Staff were all helpful, courteous, welcoming. The breakfast room was lovely and the buffet generous and appealing. Felt like 5 star luxury at a 3 star rate. Would definitely choose the Colombina for future Venice visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: buenasvacaciones
Reviews.Content: Pretty little hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The location is perfect - really close to the main action and yet situated on a peaceful side canal so you get a good nights' sleep. We got a great deal on Last minute.com. We paid a supplement for a deluxe room which was probably worth it. The room was a bit on the small side but we had a lovely view over the canal. There was a complimentary boat trip to Murano each morning which we were unable to take advantage of. Be aware that there is no terrace or outside area at this hotel - a common feature at most of the smaller hotels we saw. All things considered, this hotel is a very comfortable base for a sightseeing trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: Ellekat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on a whim when knowing nothing about Venice or what to expect. And wow, did it ever pan out! Yes, it's pricey, but if you go to Venice, you have to stay in the heart of the action. In this case, it's perfectly located within only a couple of blocks of San Marco Square and so many wonderful shops, restaurants and museums. Yet, it was quiet enough that we slept late the first morning, still trying to get over our jet lag. We stayed in a canal view room (you must!) on the fourth floor and could open our shutters, look down and see and hear the gondoliers and activity of Venice (see photos). Yet, when you closed the shutters and curtains, it was dark and quiet. The staff was so friendly and helpful, and always available (night and day). If we return to Venice, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Jessica's Trip comes to a close”
Reviews.Author: Reno12
Reviews.Content: The thing that made the stay at the Colombina perfect for my Granddaughter beside's the perfect room and location was....Marco Ive. Again he has out done himself. He booked a perfect Gondola ride for my Granddaughter...and solved air line problems.....Iberia. that's another story..The hotel is located neer St.MArk's Square and has it's own private dock...We arrived by boat and left by boat.... Marco thank you for another perfect stay and congradulation's on your upcoming wedding.... Marino

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view.. Fairytale Romance”
Reviews.Author: eagerbride
Reviews.Content: Just home from the most romantic trip to venice where the man of my dreams proposed to me... The hotel played a major role in making this such a extra special time by giving us a room on the top floor with two terraces overlookin one of the many canals of this beautiful city. The room was charming with such character and the hotels location is perfect for meandering the quaint streets of Venice. A special thank you to Paolo on reception for making our stay so enjoyable and one which we will never forget. Overall the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: ruth345
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It is a 3 minute walk from San Marco Square and less than 10 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The staff could not have been nicer. We arrived on a very busy weekend were given a room we did not like, while nice enough it had a view of cement and brick walls. I was pretty upset, but Alessandro put us in a fantastic room with an even better view. The room change made everything perfect for our stay and we canâ€™t thank him enough. I would recommend this hotel without reservation except for the basement room in the annex; donâ€™t book it. If you go, please say hello to Alessandro from the Taylors. We loved our stay and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ken_and_Donna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex to the main hotel. Now mind you this is a 3 star annex to a 4 star hotel, so it was very nice. The room was a nice size with beautiful furnishings, but a little dark due to its location in the building and the low level room lighting. The bathroom had a full tub with a hand-held shower spray. The bidet was a little in the way (why do people still use those things?), but the bathroom was a workable size. Breakfast consisted of cereals, breads, yogurt, meats, fruit, and coffee and tea to order. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, and about 10 minutes to the Realto Bridge. The hotel website accurately says you can see the Bridge of Sighs, but the bridge is currently being renovated so it's covered. Upon checkin they offered us the chance to join a group gondola tour at roughly 1/2 price (we passed) and a free trip to the glass museum on Murano (which we did). The water taxi picked us up right at the hotel, which has it's own "dock". The staff was what you'd expect at a 4 star hotel - a little stuffy, but very nice - and they spoke English quite well. We ordered tea one afternoon, and it was 9 Euros. Quite pricey. Overall, a very nice hotel in a great location in the most beautiful city in the World.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Colombina fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: golfgal9
Reviews.Content: My husband, our Daughter and her family spent 3 fabulous days in Venice at Hotel Colombina. It was perfect in every way. Extraordinary service, beautifully appointed rooms that were spotless. Lovely dinning area with bar. We loved every moment of our stay and are already talking about returning for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and best Concerierge in Venice”
Reviews.Author: UncleLeon
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Colombina Hotel, and the first time with out two teen-aged children. Quite frankly, this visit was even better than our previous visit. Our room was large (we had 4 in our room with no problem) and beautifully decorated; the continental breakfast was excellent, the hotel stafff were pleasant, and the location of the hotel was both right in the heart of the activity, while at the same time being enough off of the beaten path to be quiet and peaceful at night. The jewel of Colombina Hotel is Concerierge Marco, who treated us as though we were the hotel's most important guests. Concerierge Marco went beyond the call of duty to make sure that our family enjoyed our stay, which are best illustrated by three examples. Our first night in Venice, we were searching for a new restaurant at which to dine, and asked Concerierge Marco for advice. He recommended one of his favorite restaurants for dinner and then called to get us a reservarion. We found out later from the owner of the restaurant that they were already filled for the night - but they fit us in, immediately seated us, treated us like honored guests, and served us the best meal that we had in Venice. Concerierge Marco made all of the arrangements for a driver to take our family to my wife's ancestrial home, Dolmeggi, located 2.5 hours north of Venice. The driver that Marco selected was waiting for us at the pre-arranged pick-up point, was friendly, patient and courteous, and made the entire excersion the best part of our vacation. The day that we left Venice, we had an 7:20 am train. My children were not happy to learn that we would need to get up quite early to catch the public water taxi service from St. Mark's Square to the train station. Marco heard of this and arranged to have a private water taxi pick us up at the hotel and take us to the train station at close to the same cost that the public water taxi service alone would have cost. This allowed my children to sleep in for almost an extra hour, which made the rest of the day that much more pleasant for all. We could not be more satisified with the hotel and will (and already have) recommend the Colombina Hotel to anyone visiting Venice. In addition, we commend Concerierge Marco and believe that his extraordinary efforts resulted in our family's enjoyment of our trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with the BEST staff, location and room amenities”
Reviews.Author: missy_ttsp
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice for our honeymoon. I had researched many hotels over and over to make sure we got a perfectly located hotel and was also looking for a room with a view. Hotel Colombina did not disappoint. In fact, it was the most charming hotel we've ever been to. We met up with another couple from a hotel down the street and even they were more impressed with our hotel than their own. We definitely want to thank the staff that were so friendly, always welcoming and offering top notch suggestions for dinner, and made us feel like we lived there. Thank you front desk staff, Paolo et al! If you're concerned about getting lost, don't! This hotel is located straight back from the bridge of sighs, we never got lost! But please do wander the streets either way, as there is charm surrounding this location no matter where you go! The hotel room was the most awe inspiring with the largest murano glass chandelier we ever saw mounted on a high ceiling. I strongly recommend you to get a room with a view of the bridge of sighs, we didn't know it would be also a balcony with a stunning view overlooking it! As we sat in the room, we heard gondoliers singing and playing accordions and/or guitars serenading us from below! It was otherwise quiet outside, so no worries about boat/crowd noise. The bathroom was all marble with tub and shower, including bidet, heavenly! A 5 minute leisurely walk to Basilico di San Marco from the hotel made it even more enticing. This Hotel should be considered a 5 star, and am not quite sure why it is not. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice, and we hope to do an anniversary there again. Linda & Mauro (a.k.a. Carlotta)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Markmecard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Remedio before joining a Royal Caribbean cruise, from the minute we stepped of the water taxi, straight into the hotel, we knew we had made a great choice, very helpful and friendly staff and a lovely room with some very expensive looking furniture and plenty of room for the three of us. The breakfast next morning was very good, a lovely cosy and well decorated breakfast room and a great choice at the buffet. The location is perfect, you step out of the hotel, across one bridge around a couple of corners and there is Piazza San Marco. Wonderfull!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patricia3056
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central for sightseeing, We stayed in the economy room. would recommend it highly. Very clean, warm and very good value for money. Staff are very efficient but probably need to lighten up a little. Be careful of the cover charge on all cafe and restraunts around the area. had a great time, really enjoyed th city and islands. We found the vapretto to be a very good service and good value for money, always ask where they are going, as we found it a little confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: rachel101
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a hotel in Venice that had a balcony overlooking the canal and the room I booked was not a disappointment. With floor to ceiling glass doors opening to a balcony (albeit a narrow one) it was positioned directly over the canal with views of the Bridge of Sighs. The room was well proportioned, very comfortable, well decorated and clean and was better than I had imagined it was going to be when I booked. The fact that this hotel is on the canal and can be reached by boat from the airport was also a huge benefit. Lugging suitcases around venice looking for hotels is not one of my better experiences from a previous visit. The breakfast was also relatively good compared to other hotels in Italy, and provide an option for freshly prepared food, eggs etc, although there is an additional cost. The location of this hotel is also fantastic, being close by to San Marco Square and a number of good restaurants. The concierge recomended several good restaurants and one not so great one, but on the whole we were happy. Many of the restaurants in Venice are poor quality and over-priced. especially close to San Marco, so research them before going. The staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. It isn't often that I visit a hotel and have nothing to complain about, but there wasn't anything I'd have changed about this, although judging from some of the previous reviews I think our room was probably the best in the hotel. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonFJ
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic... around the corner from Piazza S.Marco but without the noise. The standard room we stayed in was great by Venice standards though lack of in-room mini-fridge or tea/coffee facilities was odd. We arrived when the hotel had switched from air-con to heater... but the weather was still warm enough to leave us sweating at night with no option to turn on the air-con - and only to open the windows. Unfortunately, this brought in a regular squad of mosquitos which made for some poor nights sleep. The hotel staff were very helpful overall, and even offered to move us to a different room or spray our room for mosquitos - but the only real solution was to enable the air-con which was beyond their control. Breakfast was adequate (cereal, rolls, ham, yogurt) but eggs or bacon were somewhat pricey extras. Overall, this hotel is quite good if you can deal with the negatives... but has huge amounts of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel location”
Reviews.Author: JenniferEngland
Reviews.Content: A good location close to St Mark's square, the heart of Venice. The welcome was poor for us when we arrived late one evening but the next day the reception staff were much better and could not be more helpful. They even supplied an adaptor for the electricity for 10 Euros. However, even in the Rialto suite, one of the best in the hotel, the beds were hard and my wife had to use the sun bed pads from the roof terrace to get a good night's sleep! There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room - even the cheapest English hotels have a kettle! Hot water (we had our own tea and coffee)and a small jug of milk was 9 Euros in the bar. We paid 100 Euros in total just for a few extras like breakfast in our room and a few drinks - very very expensive even for a 4 star hotel in Venice. Otherwise the hotel was good for a short trip to Venice - but don't stay for a week. Oh, and Venice gets very very crowded on Saturdays in the season.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Hygiene not acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Paris666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Combina hotel in Venice three nigh in June 08. The bath drain (U-bend ) was blocked. It was not repaired before the last night of our stay and this despite us informing the service desk regularly. They didn't offer us another room. The hotel manager refused to offer us a compensation. This lack of hygiene and respect for the customer is not acceptable for a hotel, particularly a 4 stars hotel. We will not return to this place and we advise our accountancy to avoid it too.

Reviews.Title: “Call it "Con-ombina"”
Reviews.Author: edgarallan
Reviews.Content: It is too bad the manager at Hotel Colombina has such disdain for actual hospitality, because otherwise this hotel has a lot going for it. Lovely location, nice rooms, away from the bustle of the Grand Canal. But arriving early in the morning and being charged 40 euros for 2 cups of coffee since we were not registered hotel guests yet (even though we were unable to avail ourselves of the "free breakfast" on the morning we were "officially" guests because we had to catch a plane before breakfast service began) made it clear that, to him, we were just stupid Americans to be scammed. When we asked if there was any possibility of getting into our room early, this same director offered to put us up in a less desirable room--for the same price as our original canal-view reservation. Really, at least they could pretend we represent something more than dollar signs. Next time I will pay the price and stay at the Danieli where I expect to treated with condescension.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: TavishGirl
Reviews.Content: What a great location - just behind St Marks Square, right in the thick of it all! Hotel staff friendly, the interior is lovely and very venetian. Only 1 very small gripe which was continental breakfast, not really a great selection, but italian coffee was excellent. Don't expect anywhere cheap to eat in the vacinity, you'll have to travel out on the vaporetta to get a 3course meal and a bottle of wine for the same you pay for 2 pizza's and 2 drinks around St Marks - watch out for the seating charges (can reccomend Dosodoro for cheaper eating, think it was St Margarita's square). Venice - what a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the Locanda Remedio, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Locanda Remedio for two nights, the rooms were small but cute and spotless. Hotel is in a great location, enjoyed the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bandlshoe
Reviews.Content: We loved Venice and our stay at the Hotel Columbina. We stayed in Room 401--on the rooftop. We had our own private balcony surrounded with flowers. We could sit and look out over the rooftops of Venice--truly amazing. We could also look down on the canal and were never short of gondilers singing as they went past the hotel. The service was excellent. We received great recommendations for lunch and dinner. The front desk arranged for a tour of Murano and also for our gondola ride. Everyone was very pleasant and most helpful with directions. The location of the Columbina was perfect...only minutes walk to St. Mark's Square and many, many shops! If you take a water taxi from the airport, make sure they drop you at the steps of the hotel. If you are not familiar with Venice, it could be quite a challenge to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jp3Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why this property is not rated higher. Our experience was excellent. Hotel was very well maintained and staff was excellent. Our room was very quiet (#309), decor was nice and roomy enough for the family. Location could not be better. I will return to this hotel on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: agema
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel. We stayed for three nights on honeymoon in a deluxe room facing the canal. In brief, staff were both polite and friendly, making us feel at home without any stuffiness. The entire hotel is clean and well ordered, decorated in a subdued but typical Venetian style (a mix of roccocco and modern which works!). The room was fairly spaciously and excellently decorated. Breakfast was good, location superb... nothing negative to say at all. Thank you all at Colombina! If (when!) we return to Venice this is the only place we'd stay after this positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the wonderful Hotel Colombina. It's in a great location. Well kept hotel and spotlessly clean everywhere. Rooms were a good size, beautifully decorated with typical venetian furnishings/decor. We had a beautiful room overlooking the canal and bridge of sighs. It's lovely to watch the gondolas passing your windows. Pretty breakfast room with a nice breakfast..plenty of choice. We booked private water taxi transfers, as the hotel has a landing platform. A magical way to arrive/depart venice. The staff were all very pleasant and friendly. Nothing too much trouble for any of them and no one would walk pass without saying hello. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: SallyTringHerts
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend at the Colombina which was discounted via Expedia. It was only about 2 mins from St Marks Square and 7 from Rialto, so location is perfect. The room was a standard double so no view over the canal but the room itself and the bathroom were both really big and well equipped, although no coffee or tea in the room. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh.The staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: livngston_8
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel! They were very centrally located, just off St. Mark's Square. We took the vaparetto from the airport and had a crazy time finding the land based entrance, but some locals helped us. Once you are familar with the area, it is easy to get around. Avoid the attic room. I booked through Expedia and they stuck me there and I couldn't even stand up in the bathroom. The hotel quickly changed my room to a lower floor and it was much nicer. Interestingly, our new room was on a floor of its own between two other floors. The breakfast was very nice, but then what do you really need? Great chocolate croissants. The staff was very friendly and had great suggestions for restaurants. The hotel also provides a daily free trip to Murrano (TOURIST TRAP WARNING) but then it does get you a free taxi ride right from the hotel to Murrano. Also, I would recommend booking the gondola ride through the hotel. They pick you up from the hotel and it was much cheaper (you pay 30 euros a person, usually 3 couples at a time), and it was a very nice ride. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Wijmetzntwee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Colombina is a stylish and quiet hotel near San Marco where you are surrounded by luxury and friendliness. The rooms are perfectly clean and well serviced. Breakfast is copious and delicious. We recommend this hotel for a wonderful holiday in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “romantic”
Reviews.Author: chirpyLondon
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, did the trick when I first met my girlfriend took to this lovely hotel for a romantic getaway although this was some time ago, fantastic location had a room overlooking the canal not sure if they all do so added to the experience, only problem was although not due to the hotel was that Venice had flooded the day we arrived but added to the fun. Can not fault this place really liked it and staff very helpful, good breakfast aswell. Very very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Colombina”
Reviews.Author: MaggieK
Reviews.Content: We had read some things that said to expect surly service in Venice, but found the staff at the Colombina polite and helpful. The front desk arranged gondola rides and walking tours while we were there. We stayed in a room which faced the canal and loved watching the boats go by...well worth the extra cost. The location is great....very close to St. Mark's. Don't bother with the restaurants that you pass on the way to St. Mark's...you will find surly service there. Some of the small side streets nearby with little restaurants were the best. We liked Ristorante da Carletto on Calle delle Bande....just a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the 4th floor rooms !”
Reviews.Author: LondonJenny
Reviews.Content: Locaton superb - it is sooooo close to everything you need. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is extremely clean and as said by many other reviewers the buffet breakfast is very good - a very nice surprise. We upgraded from an economy room to a superior room and were put on the 4th floor. The 4th floor is not good. There are so many rafters in the room that it is impossible to move more than 2 ft without having to "duck". The room did have a small roof terrace but this did not make up for the constant ducking. I have never experienced anything like the bathroom. Again you can only stand up straight in a small part of it. I am unsure what to call the shower/bath as it is similar to a large baby bath with a seat section. You cannot stand up and shower as the shower head is half way up the wall so you have to manually hold it over your head. I can only assume the other two rooms on the 4th floor are similar but without the terrace. My partner and I are only 5ft 3 and I managed to bang my head at least three times so anyone of any great height would find this room extremely uncomfortable. A great pity as the rest of the hotel is great and as i said the location could not be better. Would definitely recommend it but ring them and ask for a room on one of the lower floors!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lucky late change”
Reviews.Author: FICHalifaxEngland
Reviews.Content: We were advised the day before we were due to fly, that the hotel we had booked three months previously, the Una Hotel, had not been finished. Lastminute were very helpful in rearranging our stay at the Colombina. As many other reviews suggest it's a great place to stay. The large double bedroom was tastefully furnished and very comfortable. It has a superb location minutes from Saint Mark's Square and our room had a view of the Bridge of Sighs. The staff were extremely helpful, polite and efficient. The continental breakfasts were good. If you like a cuppa in your room take a kettle as there are no tea and coffee making facilities. Thanks to lastminute and the hotel for makingt his a memorably happy break. We went to see the Una hotel and, given its very run down location, were doubly delighted with the location of the Colombina.

Reviews.Title: “Love Colombina Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel815
Reviews.Content: Colombina Hotel is a nice hotel near St. Marks Square in Venice. The staff was accommodating and helpful; however, their restaurant suggestion was not that great. The room was a triple and had adequate room for our luggage. It was a little difficult to get to once we arrived. I would NOT recommend taking a waterbus, as you have to haul your luggage through St. Mark's square and through the narrow alleys to get to the Colombina. It is worth the extra money to take a water taxi that will drop you off right at the door of the hotel. The hotel had a nice sitting area and bar. The breakfast consisted of breads, sweet rolls, cereals, meats & cheese, water & juice. If you ordered coffee here, it was an extra charge. This hotel was very nice and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: LISAMELHUI
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT ! Totaly charming, the rooms were realy clean, little small but hey its VENICE.and it was the start of the frestival, staff most helpful, and the local perfect, you can see the bridge of sighs from the landing, so cool,I would go back any time and that is the beat recomentiation I can give !!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Filippo1978
Reviews.Content: We had an unfortunate situation where we'd had our passports stolen right before we could check into this hotel. The person at the front desk denied us of lodging at the hotel because of its internal requirement for a passport. We had to take the late-night train back to Milan because we had no place to stay. We understand that hotels need to verify the guest's identification. We had other forms of identification and enough cash and credit cards to pay for the room many times over (we had paid in full for the room prior to our arrival in the first place). Given the unfortunate circumstances, the hotel could have (and should have) accommodated us by perhaps letting us stay at least till the next morning to ensure our safety. A hotel is in the business of accommodating the guest and ensuring the safety of its guest. I am appalled by this hotel's outrageous behavior. I urge other travelers never to give this hotel any business.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: patannKent
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Venice at the Hotel which was only a few minutes walk from St Marks Square. The room was good and better than most I have stayed in over the past ten years. The Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was obviously well cared for as it was always clean. The breakfast was plentiful with a good choice of food. I would highly recommend this hotel. Pat Fyfe

Reviews.Title: “Recommend - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the annex of the Colombina Hotel, which used to be Locanda Remedio Hotel. Our room was very nice, with silk-lined walls and real antique frurniture, it was also very clean, with a decent-sized bathroom, especially considering that we were in Europe. The breakfast was excellent, and the lady made amazing cafe au lait. Also, Colombina has a winning location, it is very close from Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch Overcharge”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were given a room in the annex (Remedio), which was disconnected from the main hotel on the canal. We didn't know at the time that rooms in the Remedio booked for 100 Euros or more less than the Colombina. After paying for the Colombina (at almost $500 USD per night) and being switched to the Remedio, we were told by hotel staff that we couldn't eat breakfast in the Colombina portion of the hotel because we were staying in the Remedio. After our trip, we appealed to the hotel management to refund the difference in room rates but they were non-responsive.

Reviews.Title: “This is such good value”
Reviews.Author: allibongo10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed for all of the sights as it is a 1 minute walk from St Marks Square and all of the main attractions. The hotel is brilliant in relation to the cheap price we paid and was very clean and the staff couldn't be more helpful. The rooms are pretty warm and the only real problem is the mosquitoes but this can be avoided as long as you keep your windows closed. You could not pick a better place to stay in my opinion and I would definately stay there again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rozzages
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a wonderful weekend in Venezia. The Hotel is in a great location near the happening spot of St Mark's square, traditional decor, clean, quiet and comfortable rooms. The staff are really pleasant also, especially the always smiling night porter :-). All in all a great package. Qualities: Quiet & clean large room (in the annex building). It was a freezing weekend but the hotel was always a pleasant temperature throughout. Excellent value. Buffet style breakfast. Plenty of choice. Pleasant Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kurtg19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights during our honeymoon to Europe and we loved this hotel! It was so fancy and classy! The rooms were smaller but it was expected since all the hotels are mostly renovated buildings in Venice. Its nicely located close to St. Marks square and has a nice little loading dock for a romantic gondola ride at it's doorstep. We loved it and I highly suggest staying there. very nice and has a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: logcolb
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at the Hotel Colombina in September 2007. The hotel has a terrific location just a five minute walk from St. Marks square, but in a very quiet location. One of our rooms was pretty typical and the other was quite unique. Both were very comfortable with excellent bathrooms. The unique room was in the former attic. The ceilings sloped from about four feet to about six and a half feet at its height, with exposed beams. If you are over six feet I would not recommend this room, and even under six feet we had a few head bangs. The windows are power operated skylights with power night shades. The best thing about the room, however, was that it included you own private 15 foot by 15 foot roof top deck which you access up a short ladder and out a small door. The deck had a couple of lounge chairs and a table with chairs and a sun/rain shade. It had great views of the rooftops of Venice. When we checked in, we had asked if we could be upgraded to rooms on the canal and were told they would be an extra 100 euro per night. Not worth that. The hotel had a nice lounge and bar, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, with an excellent location. My only complaint was that the included breakfast was fairly limited, with cold meats, pastry, and cereal. Hot items were available at an extra cost. Because the hotel is made up of several older buildings, the rooms vary so you may want to confirm the size and features of the room you are booking. The Colombina is definitely worth considering in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and HOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtw0travel
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend that you avoid this hotel. I am shocked that anyone liked this hotel. I can only figure they usually stay in hostels when they travel so this was nice for them because they had their own room. The rooms were EXTREMLEY hot. We actually had a clock that monitored the temperature of our room and our room was 90 degrees the whole time in October. It was cool outside, so we had to bundle up when we left, but our room was an oven. We complained at the front desk and they told us there was nothing they could do and we should just open a window. We did and we were eaten alive by mosquitoes. I looked like I had some disgusting disease. We asked to be moved to a different room because we figured that our heater had to be broken or something, so they moved us and it was just as hot and miserable. Plus the rooms are so small. We could barely move. Finally, the hotel is in back of their 4 star hotel. You have to walk through their "fancy" hotel and a courtyard to get to this hotel. The courtyard smells and you feel like a second class citizen since you aren't spending enough to stay in the "fancy" hotel. Be warned â€“ you will be VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbina”
Reviews.Author: LAwoman74
Reviews.Content: I agree with IrisRobin. We must have stayed in the same room!! It is fine if you are under 5 feet tall. My husband couldn't even stand up in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Class Service..Rm 601”
Reviews.Author: SargeantGarcia
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Remedio provided an excellent stay. The Hotel managers were 1st rate and assisted us with Gondola Tours, Murano Excursion, and departure water taxis. The Hotel itself was very clean, and the breakfast was typical Europe. The rooms were probably the most tastefully modeled of our 3 stops. Beautiful wood, tile, marble etc. The one thing I would mention is that it was not a room designed for someone 6'2" and 215 lbs. I did need a shoe horn to get around the bedroom, and the bathroom was just as tight. Keep your windows closed at night as the mosquitos can be a problem, but that's Venice in general.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Options in Venice but not Horrid”
Reviews.Author: ntjvy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at it's best. I'm not quite sure what all the raves are about as my expectations are certainly not astronomical but they weren't quite met with this hotel. Here's the good and the bad of it. The Good: Location is lovely. It's in a tiny alleyway and the ambiance is great. It's off of St. Mark's square but doesn't feel like it's too much in the hustle and bustle. Some of the rooms have nice views and some of the staff could be really helpful and friendly. The rooms are asthetically pleasing. The Bad: Not all of the staff were friendly; in fact some of the staff were very close to rude, short and abrupt. The beds were the hardest that I've come across and I'm a frequent traveler. The person I was travelling with has a bad shoulder and the bed aggravated it fairly significantly. The room we were in, I believe it was 205, was up a small flight of additional stairs and would not have worked if either of us had been very tall. a 6 foot tall person would have been banging their head on the beams of the low ceiling constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, Lovely Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TTwo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at both Locanda Remedio and Hotel Columbina. The hotel rooms are comparable, though my room at Locanda Remedio was much larger than my room at Hotel Columbina. Please see Hotel Columbina for my opinions of that room. Locanda Remedio is centrally located - a few minutes walk to Piazza San Marco, close to restaurants and shops. Really, it is ideally located. The hotel is very quiet, yet within easy reach of the sights. Hotel Columbina is also directly on the canal (and Locanda Remedio is connected via courtyard to Hotel Columbina). This is convenient if you decide to take a taxi anywhere. Water taxis are, by the way, not for the budget traveler. They are, however, incredibly convenient when traveling with a young child. I used the water taxi to get to our car rental agency after our stay in Venice. I arrived in Venice late one night after several hours of delays. The town was absolutely quiet and I felt like I was wandering around on an empty film set. I got off the vaporetto at S. Marco and had no trouble finding the hotel. There are many little winding walkways in Venice, but even my 3-year-old was able to lead me around and find his way back to our hotel after an outing. You'll be able to find the hotel without much trouble with a decent map and halfway decent sense of direction. Our room at Locanda Remedio was decorated in the typical Venetian opulence one might expect. This would be a lovely place for a honeymoon. I was traveling alone with my small son and found the hotel worked very well for us, too. The room itself was the largest room I've ever had in Europe. It overlooked the courtyard shared with Hotel Columbina. We had a bed, couch and other furniture, yet plenty of open floor space. The closet area was large, as was the bathroom. This hotel was immaculately clean and beautifully decorated. The bed was also comfortable. In the morning, we would have breakfast just outside of our room at the Locanda Remedio. The breakfast was a perfect continental breakfast with coffee service and really wonderful staff. Having breakfast on site was included in our room rate, but also incredibly convenient...especially with a small child. I should note, though, that I saw very few tourists with small children in Venice. Mostly, couples on honeymoons, I think. On a whole, Venice is one of the least friendly cities I've visited in Europe. I think the oppressive level of tourism accounts for this. Although Venice has many fantastic sites, it is a tourist trap. The street vendors are forceful and would readily take advantage of the fact that I was traveling with a child. Some went beyond obnoxious and straight to hostile when I refused to buy their junk. And, thatâ€™s what theyâ€™re selling â€“ junk. I am a well-seasoned traveler and have no trouble handling these types of people, but their level of uncompromising aggression was surprising. The great dichotomy in Venice was in the way I was treated. The locals were either a bit too friendly or just a touch unfriendly (some were even downright rude). I was either being hit on (I was asked out several times, despite the fact that I was clearly traveling with a small child) or being met with coldness and disdain. I would not say that there was no middle ground, but I was a bit stunned at how few â€œnormalâ€� interactions I had with Venetians. The hotel staff are helpful and kind, though sometimes I thought the men at the front desk were a little cool. They were not unfriendly, nor were they gracious. The bellman was incredibly pleasant and helpful. Overall, I highly recommend the hotel for a stay in Venice. Though Iâ€™m not sure I can highly recommend the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: deedi21
Reviews.Content: Definately one of the best hotel I have been too. Staff was great, location was just excellent and the hotel was nice. I think you should not look any further and give this hotel a try! Definately worth especially as it is right in the middle of the city centre. St Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated. 2 Stars is more appropriate”
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star. Fine but not great and definitely over-priced. The staff was medfiocre and often rude. The cleaning staff did a terrible job with the rooms. Dust and cobwebs everywhere. Found someone else's shampoo left in the shower. Kind of a bad sign. It was close to St. Mark's, but everything is close. Really expensive for what you got with a mediocre breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sportyneil
Reviews.Content: Located only a couple of minutes from St Marks Square the Locanda Remedio offered above average accommodation. It is a seperate building accessed via the Columbina and has its own breakfast room offering an excellent selection each morning. The hotel staff are really helpfull and the service is second to none. If there was a downside the air conditioning in our room wasn't very effective and we had to keep the windows shut because of the mosquitos. The room was large though with a great on-suite.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: ItalianH0neym00n
Reviews.Content: After reading the wonderful reviews about the Columbina Hotel, I decided to switch my reservations from a nearby hotel at the last minute. Big mistake! Rude staff that were very condescening was how we started our stay. The air conditioner did not function properly so the room was very stuffy and musty. We heeded the sign on the window saying "do not open due to mosquitoes" but my husband and I were still bitten alive at night. Other guests had similar problems as there were six blood stains on the walls from smashed mosquitoes. We had three huge cobwebs hanging from the rafters and when we moved the air conditioner cover to try and get more air, we found huge dust bunnies that were hiding! The breakfast was average even if it was set up late and only had four available tables for the entire hotel. This is definitely not a four-star and definitely not worthy of the hype from other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Big Fan”
Reviews.Author: ERigby
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location - short walking distance to St. Mark's square. Very charming and beautifully authenic rooms that are very clean. We had one with a balcony that overlooked the canal and it was heaven. We would just sit there and watch the gondolas go by. Very patient and helpful staff. Decent breakfast buffet. Cons: The bed wasn't the most comfortable as the mattress was saggy and the pillows were flat, but I have found that in many European hotels. Advice: There aren't many rooms with a balcony, but if you can get one, it's totally worth it. Bottom Line: We really hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: packer457
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a wonderful part of the City. It is quiet yet close enough to St. Marks Square to enjoy the delights the Square has to offer. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the top of the hotel with a private roof top terrace that allowed for wonderful viewing of the City. The hotel was very clean and the continental breakfast was plentiful. For a modest charge guests can upgrade to include other breakfast options. The hotel has its own private water entrance, however, you must use a private water taxi if you want to be dropped off at the door. Using public transportation you are droped off at one the docks at St. Marks Square and then must walk across the square and down a few short streets to reach the hotel's entrance. During our stay we visited many areas of the City. While all are beautiful we found the St. Marks Square area to be less congested and more relaxing than areas such as the Rialto Bridge section. Because the the location, friendly staff and quaint room setting, I would stay at this hotel on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive booking practices at The Hotel Columbina”
Reviews.Author: IrisRobin
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent July 13 & 14th at the Hotel Columbina. Our travel agent had arranged two lovely hotels in Rome and Florence respectively, so we had no reason to worry about our acomodations here. Wrong!!
