We were told that a standard room was booked for us. The bell hop then proceeded to take us to the second floor via elevator and then up a narrow spiral staircase. He opened the door and we stepped into a "standard room" which was in the attic! We were told that all the "standard" rooms were in the attic. My friend and I are both 5'8 and the ceiling was 6'0! but it gets worse; the bathroom had a 2" step up to enter, making the ceiling in there 5"10. Naturally, we said that this room would not do. We were told that to upgrade to a "deluxe" room would cost us 100 euros extra for each night. We had no recourse but to pay for it, as we had no where else to go. We called our travel agent and left a message. Days later when we had already left Venice, we spoke to her. She said that she left two messages for us on 7/13 at the hotel. We never recieved the messages!!!I My friend and I felt that we were taken advantage of at the Hotel Columbina, and would not recommend a stay there unless you are very sure of the accomodations you are booking. PS: the breakfast there was only fair.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Adventure at Hotel Columbina”
Reviews.Author: USExPatinUK
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice this past weekend for a 3 night stay(August, 2007), my husband and I stayed at Hotel Columbina as a result of the many great reviews from TripAdvisor. We arrived from Milan on the train and, being unfamiliar with Venice, elected to take a water taxi from the train station direct to the hotel (cost 75 EURO). Well worth the extra cost, as we would surely have had difficulty finding the hotel from Piazza San Marco being unfamiliar with the area. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the door, helped from the taxi and ushered to the front desk. We checked into room 407, one of three 'loft' rooms (405-407) accessed by stairs from the 4th floor. We affectionately refer to this room as the 'treehouse'. With slanted ceilings and exposed beams in both the bedroom and bath, one full window in a corner alcove of the bedroom and a skylight window in the bathroom, this room felt like our own private treehouse retreat. The room was tastefully well appointed with queen size bed, closet with personal safe, and minibar. The bathroom was marble and granite and equipped with hairdryer, bath & shampoo accessories, bath slippers. Adding to the treehouse adventure of this room, was a small two-level 'soak tub' and handheld shower, as the slanted ceilings in the bathroom prevented a standup shower. In the lobby of the Columbina is a nice 'sitting room' and small bar area (the bartenders were great). Breakfast is served in two rooms off the lobby -the breakfast buffet consisted of cereal, fresh fruit, breads & pastries, yogurt, meat and cheeses, juices, coffee and tea. Prepared eggs are available for an additional charge. The staff were very helpful, booking both the Grand Canal Tour and a Gondola ride for us. The 'Venice Walks and Tours" Grand Canal tour was great, as the tour is limited to 8 people on a boat, and includes personal commentary and glass of wine. The gondola ride was lovely, but note that if you book through the hotel, you may be sharing the gondola with other guests. Upon leaving Venice, we decided to take the water taxi direct from the hotel to Marco Polo airport. While the trip was costly (100 EURO), it was a memorable and fitting way to depart the Old World Enchantment of beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbina 4-stars - Locanda Remedio?”
Reviews.Author: SLBUZ
Reviews.Content: Well, this past July our family of five booked three rooms in the Hotel Columbina through Expedia based on the super recommendations for this hotel. As we pulled up in the water taxi to the canal side entry it met every expectation. The lobby, staff, etc. were wonderful. Then we were shown to our rooms. Out the back door across a dingy courtyard into the abandon lobby of the Locanda Remedio Hotel. Old dusty desk still in place. All of the Locanda Remedio signs still up. Boxes of toilet paper and other room stuff lined against the wall. Up the shabby stairs with worn out carpet into a shabby common room. Two of the rooms off of the common room were very nice and probably rated a 3-star. The other room was up a narrow staircase and had a very low ceiling, inadequate air ventilation and a ratty bathroom. It just didn't feel right. This wasn't the canal side "view of the Bridge of Sighs from your room" property that we had anticipated. My guess is that this property had failed and the Columbina picked it up for overflow or discount website guests, both of which categories we probably fit. It needs some serious capital investment. Well, I worked my way back to the desk through the heavy doors labeled "Hotel Columbina" and politely asked Tomaso for a change of rooms. "No chance tonight but maybe tomorrow", he said. The next morning breakfast was great actually. I went back to the desk and asked Mr. Diori (Manager) about a possible change and the guy was downright mean. No way, no way , no way. No room in the "main" hotel. Ugh! At that point I moved on and enjoyed Venice. But, I just felt re-traded at the Columbina. I don't mind a two star hotel, but I don't want to expect a four star based on the booking then end up somewhere else. I am not a difficult fussy traveler, honest. We have stayed in many "not as nice" hotels and had a great time. It' just the honesty factor that bugged me.

Reviews.Title: “Geting married in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: lynneknowles
Reviews.Content: My (now) husdand and I got married in Venice earlier this year and chose the Colombina due to good reviews on this site and a fairly decent price found on another website. We were loooking for a fairly central base as we had family and guests coming over for the wedding but also wanted a decent hotel that would not break the bank. The Colombina answered on all levels and provided a thoroughly enjoyable base for out stay in Venice. Within minutes walk of St Marks Square it is impossible to get lost and also very handy to explore the delights of Venice. The breakfast was extremely enjoyable and the service very consistent. However, perhaps wedding parties are the norm in Venice as the staff did not show any interest or excitement on our big day- even our Venetian based wedding co-ordinator commented on the lack of enthusiasm. Despite this we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if you are looking for a well placed central hotel providing good service and a high standard of accomodation for a reasonable price then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: EmmaRomy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an amazing time in Venice and the Hotel Colombina was perfect. Not only were the staff, room and location excellent but the atomosphere and general ambiance of the hotel exceeded expectations. We stayed in the annex which overlooks the courtyard, and although the air conditioning was not overly cold and the bathroom was a little small, the decor and cleanliness made up for those small things. We have already decided to rebook for next year and every year thereafter .... amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Opulent & very Venetian”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller7
Reviews.Content: My adult son & I stayed at this hotel at the end of May 2007 for two nights. It was located close to San Marco tho away from the busiest area, which was great. The first room we were given was tiny with a double bed to one corner of the wall tho beautifully decorated and with a stylish ensuite. As we wanted twin beds and the hotel apparently didnt have any, we were upgraded to a larger room where they could provide a very comfortable fold out bed for my son & lucky me, got the queen size opulent bed! The whole room was tastefully decorated with typical Venetian and gold fittings, antique furniture, beautifully stencilled ceiling ballustrades, polished wooden floorboards and classy, Italian tiled large ensuite with nice vanity basin & lovely toiletries and plush white towels. There was also a good hairdryer that worked! The windows opened out onto a private courtyard. However, this room was located up a very steep & narrow tho carpeted stairs (a bit of a challenge carrying up and down heavy luggages) and a lovely breakfast foyer was at the bottom of the stairs which was handy. Locanda was an annex of Hotel Columbina & the concierge was in the main hotel which was also very classy. The concierge staff were very polite and helpful with giving directions etc. This was the most classy of the hotels we stayed at for our whole Europe trip and the most expensive and we felt like in the James Bond movie "Casino Royale'. Venice is so amazing and out of the world! There is so much to do and lots to see here and plenty of shops to visit and to buy beautiful authentic souvenirs, handiwork, artwork etc. Also many cafes, ristorantes to choose from. This was my first visit to Venice but I shall definitely visit it again tho it is the 3rd or 4th visit for my son who simply loves it there.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Yogmart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this Hotel in April. We didnt really know what to expect beforehand and we were very happy when we got there. Our room was at the very top of the Hotel . The room was spotless and well decorated with stripped Beams throughout. The Beams were a little low but after banging your head once you probably wont do it again. The beds were turned down every night and slippers left out. But best of all in this room were stairs up to our own Patio/Veranda with an amazing view over the Venetian Rooftops and all within a very short distance of St. Marks. The Hotel location is very central. We found the staff ( except one Barman) to be very helpful and pleasent and the Breakfast was good too. Overall a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone We would stay in this Hotel again if going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Omar1
Reviews.Content: The Colombina Hotel is a Great Hotel, with an excellent location, just a couple of blocks from St. Mark's Square. It is a charming hotel, nicely decorated and very cozy. We had an attic room on the 4th floor with a stunning private terrace with a beautiful view of St. Mark's Cathedral and Ducal Palace. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The service is 5 star. I would go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: PeteskiWausau
Reviews.Content: Booked through kayak.com/asia rooms. Lovely decor, but oh-so tiny! I honestly don't think our kingsized bed would have fit in this room! This is an offshoot of the Hotel Columbina, and I think it was once something else. The breakfast area is lovely, and the staff - save for one barman - were all terrific. Even knowing this was Venice, I would have to grade the room as "miniscule." Very hard to spend any time at all in this walk-in closet of a room. The location is fine: just off St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Persephone79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Columbina in May and loved it. The location is fantastic, just 2 blocks away from St. Markâ€™s Square and right on a quiet canal (the same canal as the famous Bridge of Sighs). The hotel staff was incredibly helpful with dinner recommendations and even called to see if the special was fresh before they made us reservations. Our room was beautiful with comfortable beds and a large bathroom. Turn down service was nice and included charming little touches like the next dayâ€™s weather forecast. The breakfast was very nice with a large selection of yogurts, breads, cheeses, and fresh fruits. This was a fantastic hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValenAgudo
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel. An amazing location . Our Room was an attic room, beautifull and very comfortable, however the tub was a little unconfortable. It had a view of the Plaza San Marco. Breakfast was great and very well attended and included. Take advantage of the "Complementary" trip to murano. It includes a tour of a glass factory and their showroom and you can come back to Venice on the Vaporeto, the public water bus. great restaraunts around and also a small grocery store. But like evrything in venice be ready to carry your suitcases, everywere..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: mm29
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a very central location. The hotel has 2 sections - the main hotel has rooms overlooking the canal and then an annex area which overlooks a court yard. We opted for the annex section as it was half the price of the main hotel and from what we saw of the rooms in both areas, they are fairly similar... so unless you are very keen to opt for the canal view I would opt for the annex. The hotel is only 2 mins walk from St Marks Square and we took the Vaporetto to & from the airport, as the views are fantastic. There are many restaurants near the hotel but we found the food was not as good quality as those a bit further away, everything is in walking distance & its fun to explore. The staff were very helpful and will arrange trips (inc a Gondola ride) for you. In all this hotel is very centrally places and excellent value, I would definitely recommend and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmielou01
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Colombina. Incredibly clean, roomy, and very personal, friendly, attentive service. We had a lovely room with a terrace that looked out upon the Bridge of Sighs. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not much fina than the Columbina”
Reviews.Author: Maako
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a whirlwind trip in Italy. Our first stop was Venice, after hours of searching on Trip Advisor we decided on the Colombina. We had an absolutely wonderful time. The staff was great, the location is outstanding!!! One minute to St. Marks, two or three minutes to the Rialto Bridge. We had a room that had a small balcony so we could watch the Gondolas & boats go by, we also could see the Bridge of Sighs. I would recommend this hotel to my best friends and family. A couple of notes, If you haven't been to Venice (we hadn't) it isn't cheap. I would strongly recommend taking the water taxi straight to the hotel door rather than the water buses (Vapretto sp?) We took the water bus from the airport and it took over an hour to get to our stop. Then we had to walk through St. Marks with all our luggage... No amount of planning can prepare you for Venice's map reading until you are actully there to experience it. If you are willing to spend an extra $60 or $70 to buy an extra hour and not have to lug your bags around take the water taxi. Very cool boats!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Columbina”
Reviews.Author: wenlock
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel that I am writing this on the day that we returned home. From beginning to end we could not fault either the hotel or staff. This includes both reception and breakfast room staff. Do not understand what a previous reviewer was talking about. If I do not like a hotel and we stay in a few european hotels each year then I will say so. (See my other review) The reception staff were helpful in every way,giving directions, booking cheaper gondola trip with other couples as mentioned by other reviewers. We wanted to do the gondola ride on Sunday but it was suggested that it would be better to do it on Saturday. Initial thought was that this was a ploy to fill the boat but were advised that weather for Sunday was not likely to be good and probably no gondolas would be used. He was right. It rained nearly all day Sunday. The cold buffet breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice. Hot items could be purchased but it is not necessary with the choice available. Overall a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Ponte dei Sospiri (IN TRANSLATION THE BRIDGE OF SIGHES).”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: I have paid for a room in this hotel twice more dearly, than it can be bought through Venere.com. I have specially ordered a room with a view on the Bridge of Sighes directly in hotel. But me have not warned that the kind is partitioned off from both parties by made repair work. Thus I have paid for what it has not been given. (you can estimate a "fine" view from the enclosed photo). In my opinion it is a trickery. On my discontent, the porter has declared as the robot that is the best view in all hotel. The room has been small and very dated. The TV set is small and ancient ( the last century). The bedsheet was with a hole. On a balcony been scattered stubs have . A breakfast poor, but you can order an omelette for 5 euros. It is unique - to a bathroom there are no claims. The conditioner in hotel did not work, therefore I have been compelled to sleep with the open door of a balcony. In 5 o'clock in the morning I have been woken by the Chinese from hotel opposite which beat doormats. In completion to all I have collided with a situation with which did not collide in one hotel of the world. Including five hotels of Venice ( me explained, that rules of booking of hotels in Venice are those). On February, 25th (12 days prior to the reserved one night - on March, 9th) on mine to the account the sum for reservation 395 euros has been blocked. At check out my account has been charged again by 395 euros. Thus my account has decreased for 790 euros. The hotel has not removed blocking of the first sum. I have explained this situation to the porter. On what he answered, that it not so.I have explained to the porter that it is absolutely true information. But he with a self-satisfied smile has declared, that it is absolutely incorrect information. it is not only silly, as I am is better informed on a condition of my account, but also very boorishly! Having arrived home I have sent them an extract from my account, but have not received neither apologies, nor money, no any answer in general. I am surprised by inexplicable popularity of this hotel. As in Venice many delightful hotels. With deafening views on the Grand Canal or a lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Magical weekend at Colombina”
Reviews.Author: Tiredandemotional
Reviews.Content: Our long Venetian weekend was wonderful in every way - warm, sunny weather, comfortable hotel, nice food. We took the expensive water taxi to the hotel and were glad to have done so, as it was getting dark and we had no confidence of navigating the tiny streets with our luggage. The taxi driver said that the tide was too low to get to the hotel, wanted to dump us at St Marc's square - which would have meant we wasted a lot of money. After unhappy noises from us, he decided to try to get through after all. When we reached the hotel dock, the porter whisked our bags away and showed us to our room on the first floor. It was ok, but smelled strongly of smoke although it was a non-smoking room. They moved us to a different room on the same floor, but on the corner with windows on two sides. It was much bigger, split level, with a split-level bathroom as well clad completely in marble. The bed was extremely hard - anyone expecting American-style pillow-top beds is in for a shock. The unseasonably warm weather also made the room stuffy, and there was no a/c and it was too noisy to sleep with the windows open. These factors in no way spoiled our stay, and we are picky travelers. The breakfast was fine, continental style. The reception staff were fantastic - instantly booked us on the free trip to Murano where we toured a glassworks. (Be prepared for rather high-pressure sales tactics from the showroom staff.) We came back in the afternoon in time for the gondola ride, also organised by the hotel. We shared with another couple, for only 25 euros each. It's such a cliche, but I would recommend it to anyone as an experience. The reception staff also sent us to a different local restaurant each night: Carletto, Il Conte Pescaor, and Giardinetto. The first 2 were very enjoyable, but the last was not. They gave us an English-only menu (always a bad sign). I was persuaded to try the Bangoli, a local pasta dish of brown spaghetti with an onion/anchovy sauce. It was vile, I managed to eat 2 bites only and they didn't take it off the bill. The amaretti tiramisu almost made up for it, but not quite. Like another reviewer, we managed to forget some belongings in our hotel room when we left. An email to the hotel, and the staff had them in the post to us. In summary, great location, wonderful staff. The only lack is outside space. It would be nice to have somewhere outside on the canal to sit with a drink in the evening - like the hotel on the opposite bank!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and clean”
Reviews.Author: lilybriscoe
Reviews.Content: The Colombina is a well maintained and well situated hotel just a short distance from San Marcos Square. The linens were fresh and the room was clean and in good condition. The bathroom was up to date. and also appeared clean. Our room decorations were very Venetian -- large crystal chandalier, luxurious fabric covered walls, and marble floor. Some rooms overlook a canal and some face the street. The breakfast buffet was just OK and the breakfast room was just OK too. This said, it is is still a good hotel for it's price range based on what I have heard from other people who have visited Venice. The hotel is pretty close to the San Zacharia vaparetto stop -- very helpful because the water bus to the airport stops here. The hotel staff suggested a water taxi (90 euro!!) to the airport but did not inform us we could use the nearby waterbus for just 12 euro per person -- fortunately we checked this out on our own. Leave about 1 hour+ for the aiport water bus. Overall, the staff was pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idgey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colombina for Valentines Day. Superb Hotel in our opinion. Great Location. Very close to San Marks Square, tourist sites, restaurants, shops etc. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the receptionist spoke fluent English, French and of course Italian. The staff arranged a gondola trip shared with 2 other couples to reduce the price to 50 euros per couple. They arranged our taxi back to the airport 90 euros and kept our bags for the afternoon. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast is adequate, not the best selection, there is an extra menu for breakfast at an extra charge. We were there for carnival and the costumes were very elaborate and were a sight to see alone. Venice itself for me is a beautiful place to visit. I enjoyed Venice immensely and definitely chose the right hotel. Would visit again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nicely Appointed, Small shower!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumman
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia 5 nights in Venice, roundtrip on AirFrance with lodging at the Colombina which I researched on this website. My wife & I think that the reviews here are mostly accurate. Somethings were even better than anticipated; there were small disappointments. The positives first: As others have said, the location is superb (very near St. Marks, on the canal behind it & the Doge's Palace with a view of the famous Bridge of Sighs from the entrance). While it is near to St. Marks, it is tucked away in its own quiet recess. The lobby and breakfast room were handsomely appointed. The service in the breakfast room and the small bar were just right: attentive without being intrusive. There is a reading room with internet access. Our small disappointments: we were put in the "annex," which is behind the Colombina and across a small courtyard. It was another hotel formerly that, I assume, has been acquired by the Colombina. It is also very pleasant, but it does not have any rooms with a view onto the canal. Our dining room was, if anything, even grander or more pleasant than the one in the Colombina "proper." Our room was on the first floor. It was handsomely furnished, with exposed beams and upholstered walls of damask. The bath was black and white marble. While it had a nice vanity, the shower was close to being so small that I wondered how anyone large than myself could fit into it! As we had snagged a very good rate for the off season between Christmas and Carnevale, we decided not to complain or ask to be upgraded to a room in the Colombina "proper" or for a room in the annex with a larger shower. We loved Venice and hope to return to it for a longer vist. If we are so lucky as to do so, we may explore renting an apartment. If we were going to stay again in a hotel, we would certainly consider the Colombina again, but ask for a room with a more generously sized shower or bath/shower combination.

Reviews.Title: “beautlful”
Reviews.Author: doctordeeps
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel columbina. we had a canal view room, our last 3 nights of our honeymoon and i loved being in Venice. GREAT hotel would stay again in a heartbeat! loved it. great staff. great breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: DottoreTomasso
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is a 10. Very close to San Marco Square, short walk to the San Zach Vaporetto stop, 10 minutes to the Rialto. The hotel staff is very helpful, but beware they will send you to a fairly close restaurant, Carlito's, which our one meal there was dreadful and there are so many excellent restaurants in Venice. The rooms are clean. I rate this, not as a luxury hotel, but an outstanding tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully placed gem”
Reviews.Author: Kenny6630
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must for the first time Venice traveller and experienced traveller alike. It is so conveniently placed just a few bridges up the canal from the Bridge of Sighs. Our room (407) was right up in the rafters and although a little bit of a low ceiling it had the most glorious view over traditional Venetian roofs towards St Marks Square. The room was clean and very well equipped. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful (even though we never felt pressured by them). They organised a shared Gondola trip for their guests and they were more than happy to offer to keep our bags for hours after we checked out. For a four star hotel the prices in the bar and mini bar were reasonable and the breakfast was excellent. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and quite happily recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful discovery!!”
Reviews.Author: passportsf
Reviews.Content: We arranged to stay at this hotel through a package we put together through Europeandestinations.com. It was a pleasure to stay at the Colombina. We arrived via private water taxi (an expensive, but wonderful experience, if only one-way) and loved the location (less than 5 minute walk to St. Mark's Square) and just up the canal from the Bridge of SIghs (strained view from the hotel, but dead on view from the bridge accessing the hotel). We upgraded to a "superior" room with canal views and throroughly enjoyed it. Very nice rooms with brocade fabric wallcoverings, huge Murano glass chandelier, marble bath. Room was turned down each evening with a small card indicating next day's weather forecast (nice touch) and the shutters were closed for us at that time. Delightful breakfast room with breakfast included and "clubby" lounge/bar area. The staff was very pleasant. We'd definitely return without any hesitation! Grazie, Hotel Colombina!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vermelho
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a flight & hotel deal through expedia.com. The desk staff and bellman were all extremely welcoming. Our room was small but very clean and comfortable. We booked on a bed and breakfast basis and found the buffet to have a reasonable selection of cold foods. There is a lounge area just off the main reception area where we sat every evening for coffee and met some of the other guests. Finally, there is a dock right outside the hotel so you can take a water taxi directly to the hotel if you wish. However, the hotel is a maximum of 5 mins walk from San Marco piazza, so it is in easy walking distance to the airport vaparetto/waterbus which is a much cheaper way of transferring. Overall, a very cosy and friendly hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem.”
Reviews.Author: JenR68
Reviews.Content: We made our first visit to this hotel in 2002 and have been back to it twice more since then. On our first visit we had lovely large room with a decorated ceiling and jacuzzi bath. Our room has gotten progressively smaller on each subsequent visit but have all been decorated just as beautifully with fabric panelling on the walls and beautiful woodwork. Wouldn't hesitate to return. Breakfast is a cold buffett of ham, cheese, rolls, croissant, etc. Not hugely exciting but serves it's purpose. Hotel arranges a gondola trip for it's guests each day so worth asking about as if you don't mind sharing with other guests makes it an affordable way to have a gondola ride.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Neil-no-nonense
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location and with having its own private jetti the water taxi can take you straight there no need to walk with cases. Hotel was clean and staff very friendly. Breakfast fine with a good choice!Reasonable room rates. If you can try and get room 406 as it has its own terracce. When dining out avoid the St marcos sq. areas, We headed for the area to the rear of the hotel known as the ghetto area and found some excellent food at local prices only 15mins walk from hotel, left right, left over bridge. Try to plan journey from airport to keep costs to a miniumnTRy ferry instead of taxis from MArco POlo and bus or train from Trevso insrted of taxi, once at Piazzla Roma take ATV bus as water taxi to hotel was 60 Euros for 4, if you plan it you can save alot.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic colombina”
Reviews.Author: freewalkers
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Venice for myself and husband. Celebrating 30th anniversary. Wonderful city. The hotel was marvelous. The proximity to St Marc ideal. Wonderful view of St Marcs Dome and the Bridge of Sighs. The room was lovely and spacious and the staff friendly, helpful and welcoming. An ideal place for a special occasion. Thank you Colombina. I & A Brown Uk

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbina was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: barb57_2000
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to the Plaza San Marco and our travel agent recommended the Hotel Columbina. What an excellent choice! We were around the corner from the Plaza and the hotel was beautifully European. You can't go wrong choosing this lodging for location and comfort with a European flair. Be sure to buy the pigeon food and have your cameras ready in the square. You'll get some great shots as you can see we did....many laughs. You won't have to spend a great amount for food because as you walk to the square you'll pass some cute open air restaurants that offer a 3 or 4 course tasting menu for 15 euros. We tried several and our meals were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronmedo1
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Colombina to be a wonderful experience. It was my first time in Venice and the city is just beautiful. I was just as impressed when I arrived at Hotel Colombina. The staff was so helpful and extremely pleasant. They were very informative about tours and restaurants to go to. The room was just lovely, very clean although small, it was tastefully decorated and had a lovely terrace. The breakfast was wonderful and elegantly served in the dining room. My whole experience with the hotel and the City of Venice was so enchanting and I would definitely go back again and I would definitely recommend and stay at the Hotel Colombina again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hoboken Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Colombina in November. we had booked on the hotel website and gotten a rate of 180 euro for the last minute booking, which I think is much better than the ststed rate of 395. We had a huge living room, bathroom and bedroom - so a lot more space than we thought we would get. We really enjoyed our stay and thought the hotel breakfast was lovely. The only thing that marred our stay was that we were out late one night and we had a friend with us (staying at another hotel), he could not find his hotel and eventually we told him to sleep on the sofa in our spare room. The hotel apparently has video cameras everywhere and threatened to call the police if he did not leave. We asked them to help him to find the hotel but they told us that that was not their job and as far as they were concerned he could get lost in Venice. I obvioulsy do not approve of this approach and for that reason would not stay there again. However, similarly, I can understand if this is not an issue for anyone else booking a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “could not have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: lilkal
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. 2 mins walk if that from St Marks Square. The staff were fantastic and made our visit trouble free, nothing was too much for them. If you want a Gondola ride ask the hotel to book it for you direct, you can pick a time and you are picked up and returned to your hotel or a different venue if you ask them. Breakfast was ample and managed to accommodate myself who was on a strict diet a husband and two teenage children with no problem. The bar was very small but the there was another lounge that was very comfortable and the service impeccible. The rooms were comfortable and quaint without being over the top ornate, with clean towels every day and it certainly looked like clean linen every day. We never had to ask for water in our room or for them to restock the mini bar it was done without fail. We had a room on the 1st floor whilst the children on the top, both rooms were very quiet and people were very considerate when returning to the hotel late or the sound proofing was extra good. One piece of advice, if you opt for a water taxi ask them to take you direct to your hotel as most drop off at St Marks Square and it is a maze of alleys. We took a water taxi who dropped us off at the door of our hotel which took about 35 mins and cost Euros 85 for 4 people. The same people on our flight took another taxi who dropped them off at St Marks Square and it took them about 2 hours to locate the hotel. Once again thank you to the staff at the Colombina and would we return to this hotel, without a doubt I would not even considerable another one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Great location and view!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkymonkey
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We stayed there for three nights at the end of August and had a room with a balcony. The room and hotel were both immaculate. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was great. The hotel is located in a great part of Venice, right near Piazza San Marco. Simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away”
Reviews.Author: teritom
Reviews.Content: We were told all hotels in Venice were expensive so we were not expecting anything fancy.....Boy, were we blown away. High ceilings, Murano chandeliers, marble bath, bath slippers, floor to ceiling windows and all that was in our ROOM. We asked for canal view through AAA and it was unavailable upon check-in unless we were willing to pay extra. Sure glad we didnt...there was a tiny patio where i could step outside and smoke and although our hotel room didnt have a view of the canal...i wouldnt have been willing to pay for it.....In Venice u should be outside seeing the canals all day long. Breakfast was good and the SERVICE both at desk and at breakfast were EXCEPTIONAL.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Juicylady
Reviews.Content: just returned from a four night stay at this hotel - the hotel is superbly located - just a three minute stroll from st marks square - it is very pretty and spotless clean - the rooms are not big and the bathrooms are fairly small but you can work around that !!breakfast was enough to keep you full up until lunch - the only major problem we had with this hotel was the fact that they do not allow you to iron in the room - according to the hotel reception ironing is illegal in venice - we ignored this "rule" and got ourselves the trusty travel adaptor !!!! Hotel charges 20 euro for the safe key which is returned when you hand back the key - we enjoyed our stay - hope you do as well.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Greats”
Reviews.Author: r17012002
Reviews.Content: Locanda Remedio is one of the best Euro hotels I have ever stayed-in. It is only a few meters from San Marco, located in a courtyard behind the Hotel Columbina. The staff is great, friendly, prompt, and helpful. Our room was large and very nicely decorated. Breakfast was above average, and we had a great stay--do yourself a favor and book here.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about our trip to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: nat7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay in Venice. Couldn't fault the hotel, not the best we've stayed in, bit shabby round the edges, but the location is perfect. If you have the option, pay the extra for a deluxe room. This will give you views of The Bridge of Sighs. We did this, and on arrival we we're given room 405 - REQUEST THIS ROOM - it was small and it was in the attic, but it had a lovely original beamed ceiling AND IT'S OWN PRIVATE ROOF TERRACE!! complete with table and chairs, lounger, window boxes full of flowers and the most amazing view, not only of the Bridge of Sighs but also of the Bassilca and St Marks. You can also have your breakfast served on the terrace. There was another terrace, we don't know which room it belonged to, it was bigger, but ours had the best view. Service was fine, and so was the breakfast. Not impressed with Venice, but would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to go.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the staff and surroundings to be of a very high standard and will certainlly be making a return visit i cannot think of one thing to complain about in the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the Colombina Hotel in Venice and thought I would let everyone know just what a great place the hotel is. It goes without saying that the city is the most beautfiul city I have ever visited but it was made truly more memorable by a lovely hotel in a great location. Just a 5 minute stroll from St Marks and a further 7 or 8 minutes to the Rialto it is in a great spot and nothing was too much trouble for the hotel staff. Right from the start they were friendly and warm and although not a big hotel (32 rooms I think) the staff were immaculate in there dress and they are always there when you wanted something. There is no hanging about for a tip when they do something for you, if you wish to tip them they are very grateful but they are quick to depart from what ever they are doing and get back to there duties. The friendly nature of barman Roberto was a highlight as he was always there to fill a glass or making some little snacks to pass to you whilst you had your drink. Rooms were good and comfortable and always cleaned nicely the following morning, whilst not perhaps 5 star rooms they were certainly worthy of a 4 star and with its own landing jetty (all be it a small one) arriving by Water Taxi from the Airport (even at 105 euros) is a must. Breakfast room is lovely and the decoration really classy, breakfast was very good for us but some may find it perhaps a little limited depending on your taste bjut with Croissants and cereals and cake plus ham and cheeses it had all we wanted. The desk staff are always happy to recommend things and even after checking out and waiting for our Water Taxi back to the airport they kept us updated with the Taxi's progress as it was 10 minutes late arriving due to the amount of traffic on the Canal. A memorable 3 night break for my wife and I made even more special by our lovely hotel. Thanks guys Keith Holland England

Reviews.Title: “do not change a thing !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two days in Venice at the Colombina Hotel in Venice last May and we had a fantastic time in a magical city. Venice is really something impossible to describe, centuries years of art in such a small place ! The Colombina is a small gem in this magic. The location is just great, St. Mark's is few steps away and there are some good restaurants in the area. We had a very nice and clean room overlooking a quiet courtyard. The room was not so big, but confortable. All the staff is very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hendrixfans
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading reviews of many hotels on tripadvisor and were glad we did. We stayed four nights and had a really good time. The staff were very friendly. The location was perfect, the Bridge of Sighs was visible from our room and St Marks Square is just a short stroll. Our room which was very clean and comfortable, had a canal view and the sights and sounds of Venice coming to life in the mornings was just wonderful. Our only problem was the bed, we do like a good firm bed but this one was incredibly hard, anyway who wants to sleep in Venice there is so much to see! We were warned by our travel rep on arrival about hotel staff offering FREE trips to Murano to see the glass blowing. She said we should not accept under any circumstances because of the very high pressured selling techniques involved and reading other reviews we are glad we resisted. We did get the impression it happened at many hotels not just the Colombina! Anyway, we decided we really didn't need to go to Murano, as we thought they couldn't have all that much left on the island judging by the vast quantity available in nearly EVERY shop in Venice! I would be happy not to see any more for a very long time. We bought a 72 hour Vaporetti (Water Bus) ticket for â‚¬25 each which was extremely good value as it was a great way of getting around. Buy the ticket at a vaporetti stop, validate it in the machine and that's it, you can go anywhere at any time. It can be ckecked from often to not at all whilst travelling so just keep it handy. Ours were 'checked' only once during all of our trips. To sum up, it was a great hotel to spend four nights and we were not disappointed, just don't sign up for the trips! They did spend a long time telling 'new arrivals' about them and sometimes when you just wanted to collect your room key, it was annoying having to wait for them to finish before attending to us. Otherwise it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda was buonissimo!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The perfect location, near or within easy walking distance of many desirable sites to visit. Just the view from the bridge outside the hotel was enchanting. Nice restaurants nearby. The rooms had numerous exquisite details...small, but comfortable, quiet, and beautiful. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We will definitely return! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Venice and Columbino- Si! ; Murano -No”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have mentioned the great location of the hotel and the attentive staff. We found this to be true also in our three night stay there. Our room faced the canal and was elegant and spotlessly clean. I thought the best part of Venice was waking to the bells of the Campanile San Marco and the sounds of the water taxis and barges bringing supplies to the businesses along the canal. To the left from our windows was a view of the Bridge of Sighs. At night the sound of the gondolas, some with accordions and singers, was the perfect ending of the day. I should also mention that closing the shutters and the windows resulted in almost total quiet if one desired it. We found the service to be excellent from the porters who assisted with our luggage to the barman who placed a chilled bottle of Prosecco and glasses into our gondola. The concierge recommendation of a small restaurant nearby--Ristorante da Carletto--resulted in a perfect meal on our first night in Venice. I would highly recommend this wonderful little place and especially its superlative grilled fish! The breakfast included in the room rate was exceptionally good and in a very attractive room. Plenty of choices for all tastes. The caffe latte was wonderful as was the cappuchino. I have only one warning about this hotel. When checking in, the concierge recommended a free trip to Murano --one he said would be limited to ten guests of the hotel. We would be picked up at the hotel dock and taken by water taxi to Murano where we would see a glass blowing demonstration and the glass museum. We signed on for this. My husband and I and another couple we were traveling with were taken to Murano the next morning. It turned out we were being "taken" in more than one way! BEWARE FREE TRIPS TO MURANO! We went to the Signoretti Factory where we did indeed see some glass blowing for about 20 minutes. We were then taken upstairs for a VERY high pressure sales pitch. Both couples ended up spending a great deal of money after which we were taken back to Venice in another boat owned by Signoretti and deposited somewhere on the island to find our way back to the Columbina. The boatman stopped at a dock and announced, "All out". Lost in Venice for more than an hour, we finally found our way back to the hotel. Complaints to the desk resulted in a free bottle of Prosecco for the four of us but in no way took away the sense of "being had". One hotel employee told us that the hotel owners are related to the Signorettis. Whatever the truth of the matter, we wish we had been more leary of this "opportunity". I also wish I had read some of the reviews on the Internet about this glass maker before making the purchases we made. When the shipment of glass we purchased arrives in five weeks, we fervently hope to feel better about this experience! With that one exception, we felt the the hotel did a wonderful job. We would definitely return to the Columbina--but not to Murano!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: from the time of our arrival by boat, we were impressed with the enjoyment taken by all we encoutered, from the front desk person, to the manager and the bellman. We felt truly welcommed. The bellman met us in the street as we were shopping and he went out of his way to greet us. The Hotel is beautiful in an excellent location, our rooms was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. I will recommend this hotel to my travel agent and to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great for a lone traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to congratulate and thank the Hotel Colombina who made my visit to Venice an enjoyable one. I found the service, the reception, the quality of the room beyond my expectations. I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know visiting Venice. For its service + prime location has made it for me as a lone traveller very easy to get around the city. I hope when I return to Venice I will be able to return to Hotel Colombina.

Reviews.Title: “loved so much !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just to let you know how much we enjoyed the Colombina. It's a charming pleasantly small size hotel with very personal and efficient service. Our room (400) was more than comfortable, had a lovely view which is always important. We also appreciated the very special welcome of fresh fruit. The breakfast room is one of the prettiest we have seen and everything in the hotel is impeccably clean. All in all it's been a most delightful stay and we will recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Keimal
Reviews.Content: The first room that we were given was an 'attick' room and we could not stand upright. The lift stopped on the floor below! It was claustophobic. There was a terrace but what good is that when you are stuck in a room (there is little entertainment in Venice). The next room we were given was in the Remedio - the annex. It is only 3 star but we got no refund. The staff in reception told us the the picture in the Venere(-) site was not even their rooms! That seccond room was dark and awful. The 3rd and last room we were given was about 3 star okay ish in intial appearance. The room was supposedly wheelchair friendly (we do not have wheelchairs). The first shower we had, flooded the shower room and made the floor slippery and dangerous. We complained and nothing was done - it was like that every day! Then we had ants in the room - yes they did get rid of them but.. Most of the staff were lovely- most of. We still were not offered a discount. Oh yes and the lovely views from the hotel? You have to go out on the bridge to get any view. It was a nightmare from start to finish and I certainly would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So-So with Colombina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice for our Honeymoon in July 2006. We expected great things from the hotel, but were a little disappointed. We requested a special room since we were on our honeymoon, but had a view of a wall from our window and barely enough room to move in our room around the queen-size, rock-hard bed. There are great rooms in the hotel, as we found from another guest staying in the hotel at the same time us. The service was excellent and the staff was very eager to assist us. (They spoke English, which was nice.) However, one night we asked to be directed to a casual dinner spot and they sent us to a place were we ended up having to pay over $200 for a meal. If you choose to stay here, don't pass up the breakfast - the jelly-filled croissant rolls are to die for!! Have fun on your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: tunkiemo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Colombina in April for the second time. Proximity to San Marco is wonderful, and the real joy is navigating the lovely neighborhoods of Castello -- especially using the hotel as a passage point for exploring neighboring byways and avoiding the heavily trafficked areas. Our room, 203, was located on the canal overlooking bridge of sighs. For its good location and lovely balcony, we would return to the hotel. Breakfast was lovely, the hotel gave us a fruit basket on arrival, the front-desk staff ensured that we had a reliable water taxi for our dawn departure, and we took advantage of the umbrellas available for guest use. We did lots of advance research for restaurants and events. Before we arrived in Italy we asked the front-desk folks to make reservations for things like Secret Itinerary tour at Doge's Palace. For restaurants, we recommend Al Mascaron, a seafood-rich and energetic osteria within several blocks of the hotel near Campo Santa Maria Formosa. One note: The front-desk staff recommended two other restaurants, one mildly successful but overpriced (Carletta) and the other a failure (I blocked out the name). At the losing restaurant we were seated promptly and then ignored so fully that we got up and left. We found the attention, wine and food we wanted at the bustling Trattoria da Roberto in Castello.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to say thank you for a wonderful stay in Venice ! Your helpful front desk staff have made exploring much easier for us. We got engaged while in Venice and your hotel and staff have helped to make our memories of our engagement and our holiday truly a fantastic experience. I proposed with a glass of Champagne in the roof terrace of the room # 405 in front of St. Mark's Church, really unforgettable. Thank you so much and we will definitively recommend you to anyone coming to Venice !

Reviews.Title: “the best coffee ever !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to write to let you know how much we enjoyed staying at the Hotel Colombina. After an exhausting sojourn in Roma, your facility was wonderful. The front desk staff was attentive and most helpful. They graciously answered many questions. The Hotel is beautifully designed and equipped. We especially enjoyed the lovely breakfast room. The location is outstanding and when we return to Venice we will definitively stay at the Colombina. Thank you for providing such lovely accommodations in Venice. We also enjoyed the coffee your served. The best ever !! We look forward to stay with you again the next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “magical experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Colombina in March 2006 for our wedding anniversary. The Hotel and the staff were everything we could have hoped for. We found a complimentary bottle of chilled champagne in our room and it was a real amazing welcome. The Hotel is magnificent, so clean and everything of such a high quality. The staff were all so kind and helpful and made our holiday such a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you don't mind being woken by the rattle of crockery”
Reviews.Author: DavidSSussexEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 day break with Expedia and specifically asked for the Hotel Columbina. However, upon arrival we were put into the Locanda Remedio which is a 2 / 3 star annexe across a small yard. Apparently if we had looked at the web page we would have seen that the room was in the Remedio but we telephoned and this was not pointed out. The room was small, clean and nicely decorated but quite dark. The real downside is that the majority of rooms are off the breakfast area and we were wakened each morning by the rattle of crockery and the coffee maker. The breakfast was OK - one roll each and a croissant - my wife asked for another roll one morning but they had run out - strange really when there were at least another 8 people to have breakfast. They also ran out of cheese and ham that morning. Venice is worth visiting for say three days - albeit you need to have a safe on your back to pay for the extortionate prices. We did not have one decent meal which is strange considering there are hundreds of Italian restaurants. Unfortunately there are no other types of restaurant e.g. Chines, Indian etc. The best bet is to buy a 72 hour boat pass for 25 Euros. You can buy this at the airport. The islands in the lagon are worth a visit. Overall enjoyed the trip but resent getting ripped off by sour faced locals who you get the feeling couldn't give a dam.

Reviews.Title: “very high standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived everything was perfect. The hotel location is fantastic and the staff could not have been more efficent. The room was wonderful, spacious and clean. We would recommend the hotel for its very high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: loujack
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from lovely trip to Venice although weather could have been better! Hotel lovely, excellent location, lovely rooms and very friendly and efficient staff. One reviewer said next to Rialto but in actual fact nowhere near it! However location perfect anyway -just behind San Marco with views of Bridge of Sighs. We took water taxi direct to hotel doorstep from airport but would have been fairly easy to find anyway. Cannot fault hotel for anything even inclusive breakfast was very nice. Would definitely stay here again if returning to Venice. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and really liked this hotel. Very clean, very quiet and centrally located. A great place to establish base to explore Venice. Breakfast was terrific, the view of the canal from my room was amazing. It's a charming place with lots of character, great staff, and a wonderful setting. I really liked it, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights here last January on a city break with my partner. Hotel was in a great location, just few steps walk from San Marco and next to Rialto Great room and friendly staff also helped make our stay special. We are frequent travellers and I would definately recommend it and hope it never changes.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed for 3 nights during Carnival. The staff were very nice, especially the conciÃ¨rges. We found the hotel to be very nice. The location is wonderful. We reserved the family Suite (Finice ?)with two bedrooms It was quite expensive, but we realized that during carnival all of Venice is. I would definitely recommend staying here. One of the nicest events we attended was a concert in St. Mark's Square and the fireworks on Tuesday, the last day of Carnival. It was amazing. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Colombina could not have been better. We spent a week-end during carnivale and the location of this hotel was fantastic. The hotel is only a few steps walk from St Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge is only 5 minutes away. The reception staff and waiters were all charming and helpful. The room was large with a big, comfortable, double bed and elegant furniture. Following the suggestion of the concierge we wandered around the city early in the morning, before breakfast and we discovered magic city. We loved so much Rialto area and the picturesque fish market. We stayed 2 nights there and did not want to leave. Venice during Carnivale is really magic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here in November 2005. We had lots of luggage so we took a private taxi at the end of the pier. It cost us 95,00 euro from the airport each way!!! We had a deluxe room on the top floor that overlooked the canal and the St. Mark's church. We really enjoyed the hotel, it is nice. The room was good size and nicely decorated.The bathroom was nice.Breakfast was nice and the staff was very pleasant.I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “want to go back !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colombina at the end of January. The hotel was great! It was quite easy to find and the location was so close to st marks square and the vaporetto stops. The service from the hotel was superb and the breakfast in the room made life very easy. We ended up with a room with canal view. The hotel was immaculately clean and the staff always willing to help. The hotel is ideal if you want to be near the the centre without the noise at night and conveniently located for all main attractions. I will highly recommend this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Colombina for 2 nights (Nov. 18-21, 2005)with a group of friends. The hotel is really nice, very well-trained, polite and helpful staff. Great location, short walk to all the main attractions. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “thank you !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When the concierge asked me to write a review on Tripadvisor after 2 fantastic nights at the Colombina, I was a little surprised, but I'm glad to help them and to let you know something about this wonderful boutique hotel. I made my reservation trough Venere and I reserved a standard room for a "good" rate. The Hotel Colombina is located in the centre of Venice and St. Mark's Square is only few steps away. The building is on a small canal and romantic gondolas were running until late every day. The staff was very prompt and helpful. I'm not sure where some of the other reviewers have stayed in the past, but the room was adequate size, very clean and well furnished. No restaurant, but excellent breakfast. At the end the hotel was not too "expensive" compared to many other Venice hotels. I will recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful service. Beautiful rooms. Staff was exceptional and helpful. No dinning room for dinner but lots of great restaurants close by and great advice from the staff. Breakfast was included and was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our 3 nights stay at this hotel in July 2005. The location is fantastic, steps from the center. Our room wasn't unexpensive, but on the canal with a small balcony, exceedingly well decorated, spacious and above all very clean. The staff are warm and welcoming, with good restaurant suggestions. They organized a gondola for us from the Hotel with a bottle of champagne... great! Breakfast is excellent, with a wide variety of item. We would stay here again without hesistation.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from May 14-17, 2005. We loved everything about this hotel. The room was comfortable and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband particularly liked the breakfast in our private terrace overlooking the Bridge of Sighs. Probably the best part about the hotel is it is steps away from St. Mark's Square but far from the crowd. We will definitely stay here again if we are ever in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “this is a small boutique hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Venice last November to celebrate her birthday and we were looking for something special. Hotel Colombina was the perfect choice ! The location is great, just few steps from the center, but quiet and removed from all the crowds, and some great restaurant are only a short walk away. We stayed in one of the canal view rooms, which was romantic, beautiful with attention to detail evident everywhere. The breakfast was delicious. Last, but certainly not least, is the care we received from all the staff in charge. Thanks, we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Venice, great Colombina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we found the Colombina in the Karen Brown's guide 2005 and we spent two nights in December. Following the suggestion of the Hotel Manager, we reserved a room with canal view (room #202)and we loved it !! Good size room, clean and warm. Regarding the staff, ignore all the bad reviews, we found them polite and helpful. Venice is a wonderful magical city. do not miss the typical fish market near Rialto Bridge, but go there very early in the morning. It's amazing! thanks to the English Trip Advisor Member: we forgot about the idea of "good value" and we relaxed !!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the Hotel Colombina”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a very good location, just few minutes ago from San Marco Square. The room we booked was a standard, no canal view, but with good size and good style furnishing. We travelled by taxi, very expensive, but we had a lot of luggage and avoided the crowd of the public water-bus. Very good buffet breakfast in a lovely room with classical music. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We just spent a short break, but we loved so much the city in winter and we will be happy to stay at the Colombina again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Columbina”
Reviews.Author: Dekard
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for San Marco, but away from the crowds and noise. Stayed in their Fenice Suite - two beds, lounge, bathroom - which was not cheap at 500+ Euro per night, but suited us 3. Gorgeous suite, with antique furniture and Venetian glass chandelier. Beds a bit hard. As expected we got the offer of the 'free' trip to Murano glass factory on arrival from the otherwise very pleasant and helpful staff. Pevious reviews has warned us of this trip, which includes some unpleasant hard sell at the factory. We declined. Venice? what can you say. Note the Guggenheim is shut Tuesdays, which we found out to our sorrow on our last day. Unless you've got money to burn and you're in a mad rush don't use taxis to and from airport - order a Venice pass on internet, pick up at airport, and use all the water buses.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and position”
Reviews.Author: Uxbridge_UK
Reviews.Content: First of all forget ideas about "good value" when visiting Venice. Venice is expensive. Accept this fact, relax and you will love this unique city. This was our first visit to Venice. The Hotel Colombina is ideally placed being just a few minutes walk from San Marco square. Like many hotels in Venice it is small. It does not have its own restaurant, but frankly with so many places to eat within a short distance this is not an issue. Our room, as requested, overlooked the canal. Of good size, it had very high ceilings, fabric covered walls, and good quality, traditional style furnishings. The marble bathroom was of decent size and well equipped. Breakfast, in a delightfully decorated Breakfast Room consisted of a perfectly good cold buffet which included juice, yoghurts, sliced cheese, ham and various plain rolls and sweet rolls. Oh and the coffee, as usual in Italy, was excellent. Staff were professional and helpful, if not quite as outgoing and friendly as their Southeren countrymen. Yes, they did on the odd occassion try and push visits to the local Glass Factory, or Gondola trips, but a polite, and firm 'no thank you' was met with good grace. Our only complaint was one morning when everyone seemed to have got up at the same time the hot water system struggled to cope with the demand. We travelled from the Airport to San Marco by water-bus. This is slow, but cheap, it can be a bit crowded and noisy, but as it makes about 5-6 stops at the various smaller islands it is a good way to see some surrounding area to the main island. On our return to the Airport we got a water-taxi (speedboat) from the hotel's own landing stage. It was expensive, but great fun and an ideal way to end a visit. We will return to Venice, and we will be happy to stay at the Hotel Colombina again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is a must!!”
Reviews.Author: Kitten22
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location, the hotel is clean and well presented and the attention to detail is superb, all the staff are polite, helpful and friendly but we were particularly impressed by the personal touches, such as turning down the bed each night, giving us slippers to wear, reception remembering our room number even after the first night and switching on the air con so our room was nice and cool when we returned from our days out. The location is great too it's only 2 minutes walk to St Mark's square and 5 mins from the waterbus stop. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and we would definately stay here again when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: martindka
Reviews.Content: This hotel, is right in the center of venice, very close to the marcus square, and easy to find. The bulding and the interior is an experience in it's self, the breakfeat room is superb decorated.. the rooms are big and very nice furniture, with aircondition etc.... our hotel had a window to 'nothing' which were the only downside.. can highly recommend this hotel.. Pictures from the breakfeast room, and outside the hote.
